“Right… guess I should ask what you remember last.” He says with a smile you know he’s trying to control. You’re getting really sick of this joke that you seem to be the only one out of.

“Alright, you want to know what I remember last?” You snap exasperatedly. ”Last thing I remember was me waking up on this beach you invited me to, then suddenly you have muscles the size of fucking watermelons from some miracle drug I chickened out on, then you challenged me to a game of volleyball with eight other strangers and smacked me in the head, then I wake up and everyone was a foot over their original size, then they all morphed into YOU right before my eyes!”

Alex- this Alex, at least- doesn’t want to laugh this time. He looks at you serious and gives you full-focus, and when you finish, speaks with an empathetic voice. “Wow. Is that everything?”

You shoot him a look that clearly and in no small terms wants an explanation, so he quickly follows up. “Alright, alright, seen that look before. Long story short, you’re not too far off. There IS a Gilgamesh Project that I signed up for, and it DID give me these muscles. What you haven’t mentioned is that Gilgamesh was also a cloning project- you know, why make one super-soldier, when you can just make a dozen out of him? At times, Alexes' muscles increase in size, and at different times, every Alex multiplies into two Alexes. We're not on this island for vacation- we're here for surveillance. Neither the labs that gave Alex the shot nor the government wants us being an ethics case or Alex clones dividing out of check to the outside world, so--" he gestures to the beach around him, his arms spanning the size of a rowboat. "We get quarantined in paradise. They figured there would be fewer problems and complaints that way."

“You’ve gotta be kidding. There's no way that's possible.”

“Hey, no less plausible than your brother going all Agent Smith and taking over a bunch of peoples’ bodies. You want a different explanation for why you've got sixteen brothers roaming the island, make it on your own time.”

His look and voice tell you he doesn’t have patience for this, and want a debate. You decide to go with it. “All right, what else did I forget?”

“You didn’t chicken out, mate. You went through with that project just like me. That's why you're here.”

“WHAT?!” You yell.

“Yeah, I know. And it didn’t take well in you. I can't explain everything, they told a different Alex... from what I understand, they’ve isolated all the other problems, but the ultimate effect is that the medicine… well, it’s playing tricks on you.”

“What's that supposed to mean?!”

“Combination of mild amnesia and hallucinations. We thought you were good enough to come out until you took that head-knock. You okay, by the way?" He asks again, in an off-handed tone.

You think about everything you've seen today. You take a look at this Alex- everything from his calming smile to his impossible godly physique which goes right down to his toes- then look behind him to the group resuming their volleyball game. Your brother.. your little big scrawny burly only brother brothers... separate and regroup their teams on either side of the net. Every single one is a carbon copy of the one next to him, and a paragon of muscle. One Alex jumps into the air vertically, his bowling-ball calves propelling him up seven, eight feet, and he responds an impossible pop serve with a crushing nuke from his glistening triceps back to the opposing side. You can't even keep up with the ball as it moves so fast, being battered right and left by eight different lightly-tanned colossi that are all your little brother. You shake your head. The universe shifted its status quo several times today already, but this one calls for a timeout. "I think I just need some time to digest this, Alex."

He nods once, then pushes himself to a standing position. He pulls you up as well. He's only a handful of inches taller than you, but his muscles make him look like its several feet instead. Again his hands seem to smother yours in their grip. You grimace nervously. "You've acted like this before, so it'll probably help to say that you'll get through this.. though I have to admit, I don't think anyone was expecting to be called a girl," he chuckles. "In the meantime, I'll take you to the bungalows. Grab a cot, rest, talk to mom, get this out." You look again at the volleyball court as cheers from one side combine with cries of disappointment from the other- someone must have scored. The chorus's pitch is almost one single note. Two Alexes high-five one another and switch places, and it's like nothing ever happened. Why is that so natural for him/them?

Suddenly, every single Alex there starts shaking, their bodies in spasms. Instead of being surprised or shocked, they all start letting out whoops of excitement. You can feel the ripples in your hand, as well- the same one that's still in your escort Alex's oversized fist. You look into his face to see him beaming, eyes wide with anticipation.

"Gonna have to belay that a sec, looks like we got another one coming!" The Alex next to you says in an excited voice as he visibly shaking. Your stomach drops as you look at him vibrating, and you silently voice “Oh, God, not again” in your head…
11321111.title: All as one

choices: Alex starts talking about breaking the quarantine and going where they want
One of the government agents approaches to see what Alex Six did to the shark
113211112.content:
Before your eyes the trembling Alexes scattered across the beach become indistinguishable blurs which expand outward to around ten feet across. Gradually the indistinct images resolve themselves into two separate Alexes each. Where once there were eight Alexes playing volleyball, now there are sixteen. Two stand directly in front of you, one still holding your wrist in a viselike grip.

"So you'll take good care of our little bro?" the other Alex asks the one holding you, neither of them displaying any reaction to what has just occurred.

"You bet, Alex!" the other replies enthusiastically.

"That's my man!" he replies, clapping the beaming Alex on one incredibly broad shoulder.

You simply stand there, numbly watching the two indistinguishable Alexes converse. Wait a minute-they're not quite indistinguishable after all. The Alex who spoke first looks to be about an inch taller than the second one. And the black swim trunks they're wearing each have a different number sewn on in red thread: a "1" for the bigger Alex and a "14" for the "smaller" one (relatively speaking).

"Alex Fourteen will look out for you, bro," the larger giant reassures you. "Just ask him for anything you need. See you later!"

Alex Fourteen takes that as his cue to head for the cabins you see in the distance, beyond the shimmering white sand, dragging you along effortlessly.

"Wait a minute, wait a minute!" you protest, trying in vain to stop him; you might as well be trying to stop a freight train. "I want some answers!"

The Alex halts and turns back toward you, seeming to check a sigh as he does so.

"What do you want to know now?" he asks with what you suspect is forced patience.

"How did all of you just divide into two like that? I KNOW that's not biologically possible!" you insist hotly.

"Divide in two?" he asks you with a blank look on his face, as if he has no idea what you're talking about.

Damn it, he must know what you mean!

"You just told me a minute ago that sometimes Alexes multiply into two and that's what I just saw happen to all of you!"

Infuriatingly this Alex bursts into laughter again.

"Man, you are a trip! You really thought we could split in two? Like amobeas or something?" he asks with a grin.

"You told me you could! I saw it!"

"No, dude," he says. "You didn't, because it didn't happen. The only way more Alexes can be made is through blood transfusions and that takes at least a month; I should know."

What? What story are they trying to tell you now?

"I want to know what's going on!" you say in frustration.

This time the Alex does sigh. "Okay, one more time. Doe the words "Project Gilgamesh" mean anything to you?"

"Yes! That's how you said the original Alex got to be so big and so mucular. Then they created you clones."

"Not quite," he corrects you. "Project Gilgamesh is what made Alex into such a superboy, but the treatment didn't work on anyone else they tried it on. It even caused some nasty side-effects, like the amneisa and halluciantions you're got. The scientists kept testing Alex, trying to figure out why he was the only success, and eventually they discovered the effect the treatment had on his blood."

"What did it do?"

"You know how viruses changes your cells to produce more viruses?" You nod. "Well, after the treatment the DNA in Alex's blood became kind of like that. Only instead of rewiring cells to make more viruses, it overwrites the hosts' genetic code, replacing it with Alex's."

Your head spins as you try to wrap your mind around the concept.

"So you're saying-you're saying if enough of Alex's blood is injected into someone that person actually becomes a copy of Alex?"

"Bingo!" he answers. "Alex is blood type O negative, so he's a universal donor. The transformation doesn't happen all at once,of course; it takes a coupla months and it's pretty painful. But it's way more than worth it!" he insists with relish, letting go of your wrist to hit a sanity-shatteing double flex which shows off biceps the size of basketballs.

"Who were you before?" you ask quietly.

Your brother's handsome face darkens. "My name used to be Matt Hendricks. Some of our parents still like to call us by our old names, but we all prefer to be called Alex now," he explains stiffly.

"One through fourteen?" you ask bemusedly, gesturing at his swimsuit.

"The original through thirty-two," he corrects you, shrugging his barn-door wide shoulders. "We needed some way to distinguish between us."

"Why would you do this?" you ask.

For the first time the towering, massively muscle-bound Alex looks visibly angry and you instinctively cringe back in fear of his wrath, knowing this six foot six Greek god could snap you in two like a twig.

"Are you crazy?" he snarls. "Who WOULDN'T want to be like Alex? Who wouldn't love to become an identical twin to the biggest and strongest twelve year-old in the world? And that's just if you used to be normal! Before I receieved Alex's blood I was a quadraplegic! I'd been stuck in that wheelchair, my arms and legs useless, since the age of six! Then the government approached my parents and I, with a testing procedure they said could cure me. They told me what would happen and I was glad. Being cured would have been miracle enough, but what I got was so much better: I was remade in Alex's image! Mom and Dad can keep calling me Matt if it makes them feel better, but Matt Hendricks is dead. I'm Alex Fourteen, and I wouldn't trade that for the world!"

You open your mouth, then close it, having no idea how to respond to to such sincere, hearfelt passion.

"Come on," the dark-haired titan urges you, taking your wrist in another unbreakable grip. "Alex wants you to lie down in your bungalow. The hallucinations and amnesia do seem to be pretty bad today, so it's best if you take a rest, little brother."

"Why are you calling me that?" you ask irritiably, focusing on the irrelevancy. "I'm five years older than Alex!"

"So you're older; so what?" Alex Fourteen asks dismissively. "It's pretty obvious Alex is the big brother now! And since we're genetically identical to Alex, you're our little brother too," he points out smugly.

You're fuming at that when you hear a shout from the water's edge.

"Hey, Alex Six killed a shark!"

Immediately all the other Alexes on the beach start racing toward the one who spoke at blinding speed, all except Alex Fourteen. A large part of you wants to ignore this latest insanity and simply go to sleep, but the pull of your curiousity proves to be too much for you. When Alex Fourteen frowns down at you, you have your agrument ready.

"Alex said to ask you for whatever I need, and I need to see what's going on."

Reluctantly he lets you go and you run down to the the circle of surrounding Alex Six. He's come out of the water dragging what you think is a great white shark by the fin, only it's lower jaw has been completely torn away from its body.

Beads of water gleam in the sulight on Alex Six's sculpted, medicine ball-sized pecs as he excitedly describes what happend.

"I saw the fin coming toward me, so I went undewater and when it tried to chomp me I grabbed it its lower jaw and rippped it right off! It was easy!"

"Way to go, dude!"

"Awesome, man!"

Then the original Alex steps forward and the rest immediately fall into respectful silence, staring at him in rapt attention.

"Great job, Alex Six," he states and the shark-killer preens in pleasure. "Just goes to prove there's nothing in nature stronger or deadlier than an Alex!"

A roar of assent greets his statement and you can almost feel the camraderie, the sense of fellowship between these gargantuan Goliaths. It's clear that their bond with each other supercedes any other relationship in their lives. You remember what Alex Fourteen said about how he wouldn't trade being an Alex for the world, and you can see the same feeling mirrored on every identical face.

All of a sudden you understand the quarantine and you wonder fearfully if even the government truly understands what they've created here.
113211112.title: The Brotherhood of Alex

choices: Alex suddenly grows older, taller and more muscular, and knows it has happened
A team of criminals tries to abduct Alex for ransom
11323.content:
"Oh, yeah?" you ask challengingly. "Then you'd better have your money ready, little brother. Go!"

You take off at once, running hard for kid's castle. Alex might be stronger than you (an impossible concept which is going to be blowing your mind for months to come), but your longer legs give you a substantial advantage in a race.

You're running flat-out, doing a good job of controlling your breathing, when you catch sight of something in your peripheral vision on your right. It's Alex! He accelerates to your side and looks over at you, grinning. With an effort you increase your pace, but in spite of this Alex actually pulls ahead of you! In a second you're staring at his sculpted, beautifully defined back muscles as he sprints forward like a rocket, steadily widening the gap between the two of you. You pour on eveything you have left, only to see Alex outdistance you even more. Damn it, how can such a short kid be so fast?!?!

Alex is shooting past the volleyball players like a Polaris missile now while you trail far behind in his wake. They actually pause their game to stare and a couple of the girls giggle as their gazes shift between you and your little brother. Your face reddens in embarassment and you try without sucess to gain ground.

Alex beats you to the goal by a good hundred feet. When you finallly arrive, panting, you find him standing there with his hands on his hips and a big smile on his face. He isn't even out of breath!

"Toldja you couldn't do it," he reminds you smugly.

You don't have the air to frame a reply to that and the little six year-old sitting and building the castle interjects into the silence.

"Are you Superboy?" he ask, looking up at Alex with wide eyes.

You do manage a snort of contempt at this. Although you've gotta admit, aside from the fact that Alex's black hair is curly instead of straight, he does indeed resemble the famous comic book character. Except, of course, he's much more muscular than Superboy has ever been portrayed as being.

"Yes, I am," Alex playfully tells the enthralled munchkin.

"Then where's your costume?" the child asks curiously.

"I left it at home so I could get some sun," your younger brother explains and the kid nods in understanding.

"You can crush my sand castle if you want," the boy offers shyly.

Alex accepts the invitation, smashing the sand structure with two stomps. The little boy responds by dropping his head and kissing the tanned feet that crushed his castle. Then he scrambles up and runs off down the beach.

You're inexplicably disturbed by the scene; something about it troubles you in a way you can't quite understand. So when Alex looks to you with a laugh and says, "Kids!", your reply is a sour one.

"You're still a kid too," you remind him snidely.

The expression of good-natured mirth leaves your sibling's face. He takes a step toward you and you have to fight not to retreat before him. With his amazing physique Alex is truly intimidating now, much more so than even the biggest jock in your high school. And from the look of him he's probably way stronger than any high school althelete could ever hope to be.

Staring up at you Alex flexes his very deep chest and then begins to smoothly bounce his soccer ball-sized pecs. "You really think I'm still a kid?" he asks quietly and you have no answer for him.

Fortunately you're spared the necessity of giving one as the guys and girls from the volleyball game crowd around, focusing on Alex and ignoring you.

"You're Alex King, aren't you?" the red-headed girl aks excitedly. "The most successful test subject from the Gilgamesh project?"

"That's me!" your brother confirms cockily.

An excited babble breaks loose among the teens and suddenly they all seem to have questions for your little stud sibling.

"When is the treatment going to be available to the public?" a six foot two blond who looks like a weight-lifter demands.

"It should be available by December," Alex assures him. "It'll make the perfect Christmas gift . . . if you have someone you want to spend a million and a half dollars on!"

A million point five? That's how much the treatment is going to cost? And Alex got ten million from them just to take it?

"Speaking of money, how much have you made since you took the treatment?" another boy asks. "Didn't you get stock options as part of the promotional deal? And Dad says Atlas' stock has split five times!"

Alex shrugs his exceedingly broad shoulders and tries to look modest. "Between the stock, the endorsements, and everything else . . . well, let's just say that after the first hundred million you kind of stop counting."

No way! Your little brother can't be that rich! Can he?

"I thought the government developed the treatment," a blond girl asks in confusion.

"It was a government researcher who made the intial breakthrough," Alex corrects. "The development of the program, though, was done through a public-private partnership with Atlas Pharmaceuticals. They provided most of the capital and they get the distribution rights. With the budget crisis the government couldn't afford to spend the money to build these cannons!" Alex shouts, proudly flexing his massive, eighteen inch biceps.

A ripple of ooohs and aaahhs pass through the group and even you can't deny how absolutely magnificent Alex appears, like a bronzed, preteen Hercules.

"So how strong are you?" the redhead whispers, rolling her shoulder seductively. For frick's sake, she's flirting with a twelve year-old! He won't even understand that she's coming on to him!

"Why don't I show you?" Alex asks slyly. He cups her bottom in his left hand and effortlessly lifts it up to his eye-level. Then he does the same with his right hand and the hotter blond. Both girls squeal and run their hands across Alex's bulging arm muscles.

You can only shake your head in disbelief, overwhelmed by the utterly insane turn your life has taken. The puny little brother you picked on all of these years has become a world famous, incredibly wealthy mega-hunk, holding up and two of the hottest girls you've ever seen in each of his powerful hands. Could things possibly get any crazier?
11323.title: Eclipsed by your famous, He-Boy little brother

choices: Alex suddenly bolts off, heading away from the beach towards a large building.
You see a boy running towards you -- another Gilgamesh test subject?
113231.content:
After a few minutes of oohing and ahhing over your brother, the teens all said goodbye and headed off down the beach. Waving at them, Alex turned to you and smiled. "Now I understand why you always used to work out. It sure is nice to get some attention like that every once in a while."

You stare at him, nearly dumbfounded. "Once in a while? How often has this happened? For that matter, how long have you been like this?"

He laughs and shakes his head. "Geez, Justin, where have you been? The Gilgamesh project has been going on for over a year now."

You do some quick, simple math in your head. "You mean, you've been like this since you were eleven? That can't be true! I've seen you in the past year, and you were no bigger than an average kid your age. A little on the small side, actually."

Alex places his thick arm around your shoulder and pulls you closer to him. "Don't go jumping too far ahead now, bro. You're right, it took a while for any of the effects to become noticeable. But about six months ago -- BAM! Once these babies started, there was no stopping them." He took the arm on the opposite side from you, flexed the bicep, and gave it a quick kiss of admiration.

"Six months?!" You try to think back. Surely you've seen Alex within that time frame -- though as you try to remember, you find that details from the last half a year have become very hazy in your memory. You remember celebrating Alex's 11th birthday last June, then the rest of the school year -- but everything since the beginning of this calendar year seems to be missing in details. Could it really be true? If so, was the chunks of your memory that seemed to be missing related somehow?

"Hang on." Alex stops walking, his hand holding your shoulder firmly, stopping you as well. You turn and look at him, and he seems to have a somewhat queasy look on his face, his hand holding his stomach.

A sense of brotherly concern washes over you. "Alex, are you okay?" You secretly hope that he's not about to blow chunks or something all over the beach.

"Yeah, I'm fine," he says, but the weakness in his voice does nothing to quell your worries. "This has happened before. It's actually a good--"

He stops mid-sentence, his body suddenly jerking straight up, his arms suddenly being held outward, as if being forced by some invisible presence, either internal or external, you're not sure which. As you stare at him dumbfounded, you are shocked to see Alex suddenly start to grow. His body expands both upward and outward, his short-but-powerful frame stretching into an impressive, imposing figure. His muscles on his chest and arms get even bigger, adding onto what already could be considered super-human physique. Your eyes involuntarily travel down to his feet, which have seemingly ditched the sandals he was wearing earlier and are now bare, and much larger than yours you notice, even factoring in his larger height, which now is greater than even yours. Looking back up at his face, you notice that it seems to be developing a little as well, giving Alex the appearance of being slightly older - not quite your age yet, but nonetheless a young teenage god, instead of the preteen hunk he had been before. During this entire transformation, you begin to pick up that Alex is moaning slightly, a monotone, low-pitched sound coming from his throat. You aren't sure whether that's a sign of pleasure, pain, or something in between.

Finally, after what seemed to be a lifetime, the transformation stopped. Alex's body seemed to slump over a bit, his shoulder's sagging, and his head turned down. You rush up to him, momentarily taken aback by how intimidating he is up close, especially now that you have to look up to him, as he rises above you by a couple of head-lengths. But he's still your brother, goddammit, and if he looks like he's in trouble, you're going to do whatever it takes to help him.

"Alex!" you exclaim. "Are you all right?! What just happened?"

"Ughhh…" he is still moaning, his eyes not having opened up yet. He seems to be teetering a little, swaying back and forth, but manages to keep his balance. "That was…" he pauses, trying to find the right word. "…a lot different than before."

You don't quite know what to say yet, so you remain silent as you make sure Alex doesn't need any medical attention. He eventually opens his eyes and looks down at you. His eyes seem to softly light up when he sees your concern, and a half-smile forms on his face. "Thanks, Justin," he says, his voice powerful, but you can tell it's still a fraction of what it could be with his current size and strength.

As he begins to regain his composure, he begins to look down at his body, and he seems to be as surprised as you by how he has transformed. "Whoa…" his voice trails off as he looks at both his front and backside, his large hands running across the swimming trunks that had stretched out completely and were on the verge of breaking and leaving him naked. "This is way more than anything that's happened before!"

"Yeah," you nod in agreement. "Not only are you more muscular, you're taller and older-looking too."

"Wow." Alex still is in shock, but he seems to be gradually becoming excited about what happened. "I haven't taken part in any of the Gilgamesh treatment for over a month. I wonder why this is suddenly starting to happen now…"

Alex contemplates this for a moment, and you step back, glad that your brother is okay. You don't have too long to stay relieved, however, as after a minute, something unexpected happens.
113231.title: Aftershocks

choices: look for some babes(Alex and Troy have much more success than you do)?
work out(Alex has paid to have his super-heavy weights brought to the beach)?
1132312.content:
As the approaching figure draws closer any doubts you might have had about him being another Gilgamesh test subject disappear.

He looks a couple inches shorter than your now seven foot-tall "little brother", but his utterly amazing physique is every bit the equal of Alex's. He's deeply tanned all over, which you can tell because he's only wearing a red swimsuit strained to the breaking point. Even to another guy his face is jaw-droppingly gorgeous, boasting the absolutely flawless features of a sixteen year-old Greek god. Completing his striking good looks are a pair of stunning azure eyes and long, flowing golden-blond hair.

This real-life Apollo skids to a stop in front of you and Alex and his expression breaks into a dazzling smile, which Alex immediately returns.

"Troy! What are you doing here?" Alex asks in obvious delight.

"I missed my best bud. Besides, what's the point of having your own private jet if you don't use it?" the blond behemoth asks, shrugging his barn-door wide shoulders.

Wait a minute, Troy? Troy Samson?!?! No way, that's impossible!

Troy has been Alex's best friend since they met in the first grade. The little pain in the neck has always mouthed off to you and never hesitated to get in your way when it was time for you to teach Alex a lesson. Consequently you ended up having to teach Troy a few things too. You never hurt him much, just enough to show him who was boss, but he never seemed to learn. Now the idea that the immensely muscular titan towering over is really Troy is enough to send a shiver of fear up your spine.

"I see you've had a growth spurt too," Troy says to Alex.

"Yeah, it just happened, man! I can't figure it out; why now? We've completed the program already!"

"They did say we'd keep getting bigger and stronger," Troy points out.

"Yeah, but not like this!"

"Are you complaining?"

"Course not! You know me better than that! I'd like to understand what's going on, though."

While the two bronzed, mega-buff colossi converse you stand there quietly, utterly ignored by each of them. What's worse is that you can't even muster up any indignation over your treatment; you're far too intimidated by the hulking He-Men looming above you. Not even in your wildest nightmares did you imagine that Alex and Troy would ever become so superior to you. You feel like a frigging little kid compared to them!

Your brief period of being overlooked ends soon comes to an end.

"What's going on is that we've gotten even more awesome than we already were!" Troy proclaims. "Now you're really this shrimp's BIG brother," he sneers, taking a step forward and arrogantly flexing his sculpted, beach-ball sized pecs in your face.

You stand there, trying not to visibly tremble. The thought of what the now-supremely mighty Troy could do to you with a mere flick of a finger terrifies you!

"Come on, Troy!' Alex chides his friend, grabbing a shoulder the size of a watermelon. "You agreed to lay off Justin, remember?"

"After all the times he bullied us?" Troy snorts.

"Don't you think you've already gotten him back enough? You've beaten him up every time you came over to our house for the last six months! Heck, you even made him lick your shoes last time!"

What? Talk about disgusting! Not to mention humiliating. Have you really spent the last half year as this enhanced twelve year-old's helpless punching bag? If only you could remember!

Why can't you? If you refused the treatment then what could possibly be causing these gaps in your recollection?

These are questions you should be devoting more attention to, but at the moment you're too upset over what you've heard to think clearly.

"You let him do that to me?" you demand of Alex, your outrage overwhelming your fear.

"Hey, Troy's right, Justin; you did pick on us a lot before we got way too strong for you. Then you became the victim and we got to be the bullies. Payback's a bitch, bro. Anyway, we didn't really hurt you, not like we could have. After the last time I did talk to Troy for you and he agreed to let up, didn't you, Troy?" Alex asks warningly.

"Yeah, yeah," Troy scowls. "Wait, why're you guys acting like all this is news to Justin?"

"He's been having some trouble remembering," Alex admits.

"Well, if he doesn't remember what I did to him . . . " Troy starts menacingly, a cruel sparkle in his cerulean eyes.

"No!" Alex intones. "Enought fighting! Why don't we . . .
1132312.title: Enter Troy Samson, Alex's best friend

choices: You humiliatingly acknowledge your little brother's total supremacy
You're dumb enough to actually continue defying mighty Alex
Your parents arrive to TRY to save you from Uber-Alex
1133.content:
WHAT did he say to you?!? Looks like this experimental treatment has made your little brother too big for his britches. It's time to remind the overgrown runt who's really in charge.

"Watch it, twerp," you warn him, taking a quick glance around to make sure Mom and Dad aren't in sight. "Don't forget, I can still pound you."

Instead of backing down Alex only smirks up at you confidently.

"Think so . . . wimp?" he asks daringly. Placing a hand on your chest he shoves you with unbelievable force and you go flying backwards, hitting the sand hard.

Okay, that's it! You tried to be nice, but now he's gone too far! In spite of his great new build and obvious physical power, Alex is still only twelve years old and more than a head shorter than you. You're gonna teach him why that means he shouldn't mess with you.

Scrambling up, you charge toward your cocky sibling, who simply stands waiting for you, his hands on his hips.

You don't want to leave any bruises for your parents to see, so a gut-shot is probably the way to go. You fire your right fist at Alex's carved, sculpted eight-pack and the doofus doesn't even try to block! In a fraction of a second your clenched hand slams into its target.

YYYEEEEAAAAHHHH! Oh, geez, that hurts! It feels like you punched solid stone! How on Earth can Alex's abs be so hard? His infuriating smile didn't even waver when you hit him! Now, though, it does seem to have a sly tilt to it.

"Forgot, didn't you?" he teases. "All of my cells are sixteen times denser than a normal human's; that's part of what makes my muscles so strong. Want to see exactly how strong they are?" he asks threateningly.

You don't have a chance to answer before Alex winds up and punches you in the stomach in return. What feels like a miniature sledgehammer impacts directly on your torso.

You thought your hand hurt, but that's nothing compared to the supernova of pain that explodes through you now. You collapse instantly, hugging your midsection, and vomit. You actually wonder if you might have thrown up any of your internal organs.

For a while you simply writhe there, head twisted away and trying not to cry. Then a shower of sands sprays across your face. Blinking away the stinging particles that landed in your eye, you look up to see Alex's tanned right foot kick some more sand toward you.

"Come on, wuss!" the dark-haired, muscle-bound preteen taunts. "Is that all you got? I only used about a quarter of my power on that punch!" he brags, flexing a rippling, softball-sized bicep.

In that instant pure rage overwhelms your pain. You're lying here while your little brother trash-talks you and kicks sand in your face, as if he's some buff beach bully and you're the ninety-eight pound weakling he's picking on. That's not how things are, damn it!

If Alex's cells are so dense, then you just need to hit him in a more sensitive place. You bet a punch to the eye would work. It would also show up pretty clearly, but you're past caring about that.

Slowly, plainfully, you rise up and without a word strike at Alex's face. Like lightning he ducks your punch. You swing with your left hand and he dodges once again.

He retreats before you, exceptionally lithe and sure-footed in the shifting sand, while you miss him again and again.

"My speed and reflexes were improved too," Alex observes lightly, still wearing that maddeningly arrogant smirk. Frustrated you throw yet another punch at him and this time Alex catches your fist in his left hand, stopping it effortlessly.

You try to pull your hand back, but you can't come close to breaking Alex's grip.

"Your still don't get it, do you?" Alex asks, shaking his head in seeming disappointment. "Project Gilgamesh was a MILITARY project, moron! The attribute enhancement procedure was designed to create the ultimate super-soldier. You know, like Captain America in the comics?"

You cease struggling as the terrifying implications of that statement sink in.

"The formula was a total failure with you, but with me they succeeded way beyond their wildest dreams. You're looking at a real life superboy, bro! I can bench press over two tons, run the mile in three minutes and seven seconds, and hold my breath for fifteen minutes. My vision is better than twenty-twenty and I've taken a baseball-bat-hit across the chest without it even leaving a mark."

You listen to Alex boast in stunned silence, praying that he's lying. Except . . . you don't think he is.

A bolt of pain from your trapped hand brings you back to reality; Alex has begun to squeeze. Frantically you work to win free, ineffectually prying at Alex's iron fingers with your free hand. Soon the pain gets so bad that you drop to your knees before him, bringing you below his eye level.

"Alex, don't! Please!" you beg.

Thankfully he stops squeezing, though he doesn't lessen the pressure on your trapped hand.

"That's better, bro," Alex says condescendingly. "This isn't the first time you've ended up kneeling before me, if you could only remember. Once I started changing I stopped taking your crap. You might be older and taller than me, but I'm definitely the big brother now! So who's your boss, weakling?" your kid brother asks you with a sneer.
1133.title: Outmatched In Every Way

choices: he decides to keep humiliating you.
he thinks you've been humbled enough and takes care of you
11331.content:
"...So who's your boss, weakling?" Alex asked.

You keep your head down and your eyes tightly shut, as you try to overcome the lessening pain in your hand. Taking deep breaths seems to help, as you try to think a way to turn things around. But almost instantly you realize there is no way you can fight Alex or escape from him, not anymore.

You open your eyes, and hesitantly lift your head, ready to do what you never thought you would do. As you do so, you look at Alex's body, starting with his legs. Just his legs were easily thicker than your arms, and were covered in veins.

Then you looked at his thighs, which were even bigger and also covered in veins. The muscles seemed to compete for space with each other, and you could tell that Alex's thighs were probably rubbing constantly against each other whenever he walked, because of their massive size.

You then looked at your brother's swimming trunks, gazing at the shape of something huge.

Going up, you look at his abs. He has eight, and you can see that soon it will be ten. There is a narrow valley between them, around one or two inches deep.

His chest was also very impressive. Two massive slabs of muscle, each of them at least twice as thick as your own. His shoulders looked like cannonballs and his arms were at least as thick as your thighs, if not more. His back was wider than yours.

All in all, his whole body, now that you looked at it a second time and more attentively, was incredibly ripped and muscular, and if Alex suddenly became as tall as you, while keeping the same proportions, you had no doubt that every muscle would be three times bigger than yours, and a few dozen times stronger, at least.

Your observations are cut short by your brother's voice. "Well? Don't you have something to say yet?" Alex asks, as he lifts you up, so that you're eye level with him. The smile on his face was almost innocent, for some reason.

You look to the side, and sigh. "You," is the almost silent answer you give, while trying to focus on anything away from Alex.

"Me what?" He asks, waiting for clarification, and putting his ear almost in front of you, his free hand cupping it, mockingly.

"You're my boss," you mutter, not wanting to admit it.

"See, that wasn't so hard, now was it?" He says cheerfully, while letting you free and dropping you to the ground. You rub your hands, the pain almost gone. Although it hurt a lot just a minute ago, now you could almost ignore it. Your lower chest area and your upper row of abs still hurt quite a bit, though, but you bear it, feeling humiliated enough and not wanting to show more weakness than you already have.

You stand up, a bit unsteadily. Your brother looks at you, before...
11331.title: Aknowledge your little brother's total supremacy.

choices: After eating, you go to sleep.
113312.content:
You were standing up, a little unsteadily. Alex looked at you for a moment before smirking and picking you up in his arms. "Hey!" you protest, powerless. Alex just keeps smirking and says "You looked a little worse for the wear, so I think we could just go back. I'll take you there."

"What? Let me go, Alex!" You struggle, but your efforts are futile. Soon, you feel one of his arms wrapping around your legs, stopping them. The other arm wraps around your back and grabs one of your arms, stopping it. Your other arm is trapped between your own body and Alex's strong chest, unable to escape.

"Nope! And I'll carry you all the way! So get used to it. Or do I have to make you?" He says, nonchalant. You gulp, and anything you were going to say dies in your throat. Closing your eyes, you remain still, cold fear running through your spine. "Thought so".

He starts walking, and you ask "I-I thought you wanted to go to the snack bar." You want to hit your head against a wall for stuttering.

"Yeah, but since someone decided to get hurt, we're going back to the house."

"The house?"

"You don't remember that either? We're staying on a really nice house, just a couple yards away from the beach. We're alone, but we've got food and everything else, so don't worry."

"So Mom and Dad are not here, and no one else is around? What about the snack bar?" You didn't like the idea of being alone with Alex, considering he could easily beat you up all day if he wanted payback for anything else you may have done to him. Alex was normally a very sweet and kind boy, a bit annoying perhaps, like most kids his age, but having all that strength and power over you could end up making him... well, not so sweet. You shiver a bit at the idea of Alex being a total jerk to you. That felt horribly wrong, even without the fact that Alex was now strong enough to lift a car.

"What, you scared of being alone with your little brother?" Alex giggles at his own question, before answering "Nobody else is around, and the snack bar is a bit far from here." He stops and you look at the house in front of you both. It was really big, at least five hundred square yards. It looked more like a beach resort than anything else.

"There it is." Alex resumes walking and enters the place through a glass panel door, opening with his foot. Inside it was really spacious, since there wasn't a lot of furniture, so it didn't feel cluttered. The walls were painted a slightly beige color. There were a couple couches around a coffee table on one side of the room, a dining table on the other. You didn't get to see anything else as Alex kept walking, entering a hallway and then one of the rooms on the right. There was a single king sized bed at the end of the room, near a large glass door that lead to a garden, a nightstand on each side of the bed, a walk-in closet, and a desk with a chair opposite of the bed.

"Why don't I remember all this?" You can't help but ask yourself. Before Alex says anything, you point a finger at him and say "Don't answer." He just pouts, going straight to the bed, and lays you there. You decide to ignore the fact that Alex just treated you like a little kid and start thinking about everything that happened in the last few minutes, feeling mind-blown. You don't even bother with your brother sitting besides you, his heavy, muscular body making the mattress groan a bit, until he starts poking your cheek.

"What?" You ask, feeling a bit annoyed by the poking, but not showing it, just in case Alex decided to punish you for that.

"How do you feel?" He asks, a little worried. That surprises you a little bit.

"What do you mean?"

"Does it hurt still?" He must be talking about the punch he gave you earlier.

"Not as much anymore" you say before touching your chest, and feeling the area flare up in pain. "Ow!" You yelp and stop paying attention to Alex, who feels a little guilty, "I guess it still does." You mutter to yourself.

"Sorry." Surprised, you look at Alex, who looks a little ashamed. You can tell that he's still a really kind and sweet kid, and you feel a bit stupid for thinking that he would ever change just for having giant muscles harder than steel and much more strength than any other man on Earth.

"It doesn't matter. I was kinda being an idiot." You tell him, your eyes looking anywhere but where your brother is. It was true, and all because you couldn't accept the fact that now your younger brother was physically superior to you in every way.

You feel his powerful arms wrap around you, an inescapable grip that feels oddly comforting, while avoiding any contact where he hit you before. "I'll try to be more gentle with you from now on. I just forgot that now you're really fragile compared to me," he says. You looked at him with annoyance this time. "I'm not made of glass, bro."

He smiles at you playfully, says "I don't think so!" and gives you a noogie. You try to escape, but you can't. "Okay, stop, stop, stop!" You plead, laughing a bit. He does as you ask, laughing too.

After the laugh subsides, you look at him, serious. "I know that I can't ever compare to you in anything physical, not anymore, but you are still my brother. If you ever need anything from me, I'm here for you."

He looks at you, then hugs you, carefully. Still, you can tell how easily he could crush your body to paste, if he ever wanted. You put your arms around him, and pat his back. He releases you and stands up. "Thanks, Justin." He rubs his neck, feeling a little awkward. You watch the huge mound of muscle your brother calls a bicep and you can't help but gulp.

"So... since we are not going to the snack bar, wanna make some food? Gotta feed those muscles of yours," you say, trying to take your eyes off your brother's arm, only to look at the rest of his godlike body. Alex, though, just happily drags you to the kitchen, his iron grip on your wrist gentle but firm and unbreakable.
113312.title: he thinks you've been humbled enough and ta...

choices: Nothing out of the ordinary. You head for the bathroom.
Something unexpected.
1133121.content:
You sat at the dining table, feeling mind-blown again, but also slightly disgusted. You just watched your younger brother eat (if it could be called that) more food in one hour than you could handle in a day.

Your brother looks at you, smiling. “That was so tasty! You really are the best, bro!” He says, rubbing his abs. Since he was not wearing anything besides his swimming trunks, you could see that his stomach, full of so much food, barely changed the shape of his belly, looking almost as ripped and muscular as earlier in the day, as if he hadn’t eaten as much as he did. You can’t help but voice your thoughts aloud.

Your brother smirks. “That’s cuz all of my muscles are much stronger and harder, and same with my organs. If I wanted, I could swallow bones, and they’d be crushed to pieces. So, I can eat a lot and the food just gets compressed while it’s being digested.”

“That’s insane” is the only thing that comes out of your mouth.

What both of you didn’t know was that Alex’s gastric acids were now so strong that they could dissolve metal, and the only thing strong enough to handle them was Alex’s own flesh. In addition, he absorbed a lot more stuff from what he ate and his digestive system worked a lot faster, so it was easier for him to grow bigger.

Alex just chuckles and stands up. The top of his head still doesn’t reach above your chest, but knowing he’s still a lot stronger than you makes you feel slightly intimidated when he approaches you. He looks at your chest and touches it, making you feel a bit of pain, but nowhere near what you felt a couple hours ago. Still, you
wince a bit.

He quickly retracts his hand, muttering “sorry” and looking guilty.

“It’s nothing,” you say. He still looks at your chest with worry, and you can’t help but smile, feeling happy that your brother really cares about you, even if he was a little too rough with you. “I’m feeling tired so I’m going to sleep in a bit, you want to stay up?” You ask. You didn’t feel really tired, not physically, but you wanted to go to bed and let your mind process everything that happened. Maybe try to jog your memory too, see if you could remember anything.

“Nah, I’m going to sleep too.” He says, letting out a yawn, while you stand up and take the dishes to the kitchen.

“OK. I’ll take care of this, you go to- wait, where do you sleep?” You ask, since you have only seen one bedroom, and while the bed in your room is big enough, you don’t think it would be a good idea to share it. Alex tends to be a bit... clingy, during his sleep. He grabs his pillow, his blankets, anything within reach while he sleeps. Before, that wasn’t a problem. You even had thought it was cute the few times he had nightmares and came to your bedroom asking if he could sleep with you and ended up burying his head in your chest. Now, his bare hands were stronger than your whole body. You are not going to risk being crushed in Alex’s arms during your sleep.

“Oh, there is another bedroom, right in front of yours. That’s where I sleep.” He answers, while you wash the dishes. Your parents both worked all day since Alex entered elementary school, so you learned early on how to do some basic house chores and didn’t feel any kind of shame for doing them, unlike some of your school friends, who thought they were ‘a woman’s job’.

“All right, I’ll see you in the morning, then.” You wish him good night as Alex leaves, a slightly muffled yawn escaping him as he goes to his room.

As you’re left alone, you think back to everything that happened since morning. Still hard to believe, yet very real.

Even as you try to focus on your chores, the memory of Alex’s muscles pressed against your body, their impossible size and definition, and the ridiculous strength he had, has you growing a boner.

The last plate is clean and immediately you go to your room and close the door. Thankful that Alex had already gone to asleep, you can’t help but look down at the tent that had built. Just about to take care of the problem, you stop immediately and remind yourself that Alex is your brother.

Opening the door, you slip into the hallway, looking for the bathroom. Taking a cold shower seems like a good idea to get rid of your troubles. You stop, looking into Alex’s room and see…
1133121.title: Dinner and then sleep.

choices: ...his house, where he makes you his servant as punishment for being so defiant.
...the Gilgamesh Project HQ where he goes in for the 2nd stage of it.
...somewhere else of his choosing.
11332.content:
"You aren't. You haven't and you never will be." you said, weakly.

The look on Alex's face goes from any sort of arrogance to a stone-cold fury. It sends a feeling of dread so deep down your body that you feel like you want to melt into the sands of the beach and never come back out ever again. He walks behind you and lifts you up with one hand, then wraps his other arm around your neck, squeezing and flexing his muscles in it.

"I'm going to say this one last time." he emphasizes with more of a squeeze around your neck. "I've been patient. I've been playing it nice. But this...this jealousy bullshit you keep spouting, is gonna stop one way or the other today. I get it, you hate that I have all the power between us and you have nothing. That's thrown your world into chaos. But if you keep this up..."

Silence for a moment, as he leans in.

"I'll kill you."

Your eyes go wide. There's no emotion in his voice, no giveaways that might make him look like he's joking. He means it...Alex, your brother, will end your life.

"The military will make sure I don't get prosecuted, I'm too valuable. You on the other hand, aren't. Like I said I've been patient, more patient than you probably deserved, 'big' brother. If you don't stop this bullshit, I'll put you down and out of everyone's misery, including your own, because I've heard nothing but whining and bitching from you since this all started, and everyone's sick of it, especially me."

While he said all of this, you were barely conscious, he was squeezing 'just' hard enough to not make you pass out or hurt you, but it was hard keeping your mind aware enough to really do much of anything, and he knew it too, it was clear he was used to putting you in such a position.

"So, this is your last chance, I won't do it now, but if you do this shit one more time, that's it, you're dead meat, so I recommend you take some time to cool down, sort your crap out, and get over it."

He finally drops you at this point, but follows it up by knocking you down and pinning you there underfoot for a few minutes, with your coughing and wheezing into the sand from nearly passing out before. Once he figures you've had some time to recover, you're roughly tossed over his shoulder and carried to...
11332.title: Pointless Defiance

choices: Ask your parents more about the project.
Whoa!  Before you can ask, Alex is growing as he’s eating!
11333.content:
Alex begins to squeeze your hand again and you feel like your hand might break at any moment.

“Well? Say it! Who’s the big brother now?” he says demanding you to submit. You close your eyes and clench your teeth but it doesn’t lessen the pain. You feel you’re either seconds away from finally submitting to your brother’s dominant strength or your arm snapping, when suddenly…

*Beep Beep* You suddenly hear a loud car horn coming from the beach’s edge. Both of you turn your heads towards the noise and thankfully Alex lessens his grip a bit. A huge car is parked at the beach’s parking lot, and two figures get out. It’s your mom and dad! But you’ve never seen that car before, and why would they even need a car that big?

“Alex leave your brother alone and come eat honey!” your mom calls from a few feet away. Alex turns back to you before adding “You got lucky…I’m starving!” He then heads for the car running at an incredibly fast sprint thanks to his well-toned calves and thighs. You‘re happy that your hand has been released, but it still hurts, and so you nurse your near crushed hand as you walk towards the picnic table.

You approach the wooden picnic table where Alex is already chowing down and notice the spread was massive, with enough soda and sub-sandwiches to feed an army, or at least an army’s special project. Alex holds a massive foot long sub in one hand and takes a humongous bight out of it. He looks confused as you head towards one of the may looking delicious sub sandwiches.

“Uh, son that table is for Alex’s lunch.” Your dad says from behind the new (?) car. He hauls a smaller regular sized cooler from the trunk and sets it on a nearby table where your mom is already sitting. “You know our lunch is over here” your mom adds, “Are you feeling okay?”

“I...think so…” you say a little distracted. You were amazed that all of that food was for your younger brother, but then again with how fast he was scarfing things down he probably would finish the large lunch in front of him.

“Sorry bro, but I gotta feed these guns you know?” he explains with a mouthful of deli meat and wheat bread in his full mouth. He gives you an example of said “guns” by flexing his right arm and making his bicep bounce and making it look unbelievably hard.

Sitting down next to your mom and dad (who still look absolutely astounded by Alex’s physique and appetite) you help yourself to a small sandwich and try to wrap your head around what’s happening.

“Hey, when did we get that car?” you ask both of your parents. They look at towards each other and then back to you. “Honey did you bump your head when you were roughhousing with Alex?” your Mom asks sounding quite concerned. “You know that we bought that with the project money.”

“Yeah and a good thing we did too” your dad adds. “With an appetite like that we need all the room for his lunch!” He says only half joking.

Hmm…that sort of made sense. Maybe you should ask your parents some more about the project you might be able to find out what the new “superboy” Alex’s kryptonite is…
11333.title: Your parents arrive to TRY to save you from Ube...

choices: Justin and/or Alex start feeling very weird
The beach seems a lot quieter now.
Something else of your choosing
114.content:
(Writer's note: I don't really directly say if Alex has grown, or if Justin has shrunk, so just go on what you'd think happens more)

He looked as tall as you were, but that had to be impossible. Alex had never been as tall as you, ever. He'd been a decently sized kid, but certainly not as big as you.

Seeing you slowing down, he stopped, still annoyed, "What's keeping you already? Did you forget something?"
"Alex..." you say, scratching your head, 'When did you get to the same height as me?"
He looked honestly surprised, "Did somebody hit you on the head while you were asleep? I've been as tall as you for awhile."
"...R-right, tall as me." You say, following Alex, still feeling like something isn't right.

Alex shouldn't be as tall as you, he just shouldn't! Even so, as you and him walk along to the snack bar, something seems to get your attention.
114.title: Is he that big, or are you that small?

choices: You faint
You wake up with your body back to normal
Alex grows even larger
1141.content:
That's when strange tingle feeling overcame you. At first you ignore it think was just a sunburn,but you slowly notice your shorts became baggier.That's when you realized you were shrinking. As your height slowly diminished , your muscles with it.

Your pecs,biceps and shoulders became flat and scrawny. Next your 6-pack faded away leaving it slim and flat.Your thighs now 3 niches in width as your claves that was the size of small hills deflating out if exists. Last your crotch that's was once 6 shrink until it was 1 inch in length, along with your balls now the size of peas.

Panicing trying to process what just happened to you , what happened to your once prune body. That's when you looked up at Alex now to see where it has gone.

Watching Alex muscles swell and inflat.Frist his pecs pushed forward until they were a foot awlay from his chest.His shoulders broaden as his biceps turned into mountains. His faded 3-pack turned into 6-pack thend a well-built 8-pack. His thighs widen reaching a good 1 inches and his calves swelled in over sized soccer balls. His cotoch lengthen and thirteen show in though his tight shorts looking about 8 inches long.Last he grow until hitting the 10 ft mark.His shorts struggleing to contain his growth failed as a ripping sound echoed though the beach.Reveling his new manhood for everyone to see.

Character analysis
Justin standing at 3"5 his muscles neverly non-existant and weighting 110 pounds. Still has his tan, good-looks and shiny blonde hair.

Alex standing at 10ft tall weighing 300 pounds of pure muscles that enlarges at the slightest movement.
1141.title: Justin and/or Alex start feeling very weird

choices: Brandon seems to be getting even bigger as he surfs.
Alex has inched closer to Brandon's height.
There are several other kids Brandon's height at the beach.
115.content:
You rub your eyes, realizing they must be tricking you. For a moment, you thought that Alex was looking different than you remembered, but as you examined him closer, you realized he was the same five-foot-tall skinny twelve-year-old that you remembered.

"Why are you looking at me like that?" he asks, looking suspiciously at you.

"Nothing," you mutter. "No reason. Sorry." A strange feeling washes over you, what your english teacher had called a "sense of foreboding," but you just felt creeped out. Something weird or unexpected was about to happen - you were sure of it.

"Hey, it looks like Brandon's finally made it!" Alex exclaims. "Hey, Brandon! Over here!" He waves his hands in the air in a signaling manner.

Brandon, you recall, is your brother's best friend, slightly older than your brother but nearly the same size, with the same goofy sense of humor. Just like Alex, Brandon got on your nerves slightly, but you things could be worse - overall, you got along okay with him.

You turn around to see Brandon in the distance, who's heading your way, smiling and carrying a couple of surfboards. As he gets closer, that ominous feeling comes back in spades, and you soon realize why - Brandon is much taller than he has any right to be. By the time he's standing next to you and your brother, you're eye-level with his knees, and his face looms overhead. He has to be nearly twenty feet tall! He still looks like a skinny teenager, he's just four times the height of one!

But Alex acts as if nothing is different or wrong. "Hey, Brandon, what took you so long?"

He smiles sheepishly. "It took them a while to get my surfboard ready at the rental shack. And after I called them yesterday and reminded them I was coming down too!" He shakes his head. "I guess that's the price I pay. I got yours too!"

"Thanks!" Alex grins, giving Brandon's shin a playful punch, one that you're sure the giant barely feels. "Now we can hit the waves!"

You're completely unsure of what's going on, but you don't get a chance to ask any questions or voice your confusion, as the two boys run out towards the water, diving in and paddling out several dozen feet. Rubbing your temples, you try to make sense of everything, but nothing clicks for you. As you look out towards Alex and Brandon, who are having the time of their lives, you suddenly realize...
115.title: Meet Brandon, Alex's Giant Best Friend

choices: The shortest boy on the team grows into the biggest!
Something's in the Gatorade... All the boys grow between 1-2 feet taller.
Each time a team scores a goal, they grow a foot.
The boys become older, turning into a surprisingly muscular middle school team
Practice is over and it's Game Time; the opponents are all at least 8 feet tall!
12.content:
"Coach! Are you alright?"

You feel a sense of dull pain on the side of your face, which is smushed against what seems to be grass. Your vision is blurry as you try to push yourself up. A general sense of disorientation fills your head.

As your vision comes back to you, you begin to try to make sense of your surroundings. You seem to be outside, in some kind of park. Looking around, you realize it seems to be a soccer field, complete with chalk outlines and two nets. The bright sunlight warms your skin, and the air has a fresh smell to it.

In front of you is a young boy who looks to be about ten years old. He wears a red soccer jersey with black shorts, has shaggy bright-red hair and freckles. He's holding a soccer ball and has a worried look on his face.

"Coach Justin?" The boy sighs in relief. "Whew, I'm glad you're alright! I'm sorry for kicking too hard. I hope getting hit in the side of the head with the ball and getting knocked to the ground didn't hurt too bad."

Scratching your head, you ask, "W-Who are you?"

Another boy, slightly taller and skinnier, wearing the same shorts but shirtless and with medium-length black hair and glasses, comes over and chuckles. "Boy, that ball must have hit you harder than we thought. That's Luke and I'm Jordan. Do you know where you are?"

You look around the field and see a total of eight boys, all nine or ten years old and all dressed in the same uniform, half with the jersey on and half shirtless. They all look at you, some with concern on their faces and some amused. Scanning the rest of the field and it's surroundings, you don't see any other person within sight.

Looking down at yourself, you see you're wearing a grey polo shirt with the word "Coach" embroidered on it, have a whistle hung around your neck, and are holding a clipboard. As you look back up at the boys, you put two and two together. "I'm... your coach?"

"Yeah!" a third boy with short brown hair and a bit stocky, chimes in. "Okay, guys, he's alright! Let's get back to playing!"

You stand back as Luke throws the ball back in and the boys resume play. You're speechless, not sure of what to think. For some reason, these kids, who you've never seen before, recognize you as someone they've known a while. It's all very strange; you've never coached anything, much less youth sports. You weren't even sure that at seventeen you'd be allowed to. But, for now, any way, you decided to go with the flow.

As the scrimmage goes on, however, you notice something strange happening with the boys...
12.title: Youth Soccer Coach

choices: Call a break!
Watch as they continue practicing, slowly growing bigger and bigger!
Something else.
122.content:
Okay, so maybe that soccer ball did hit your head a little hard. You definitely didn’t remember these boys, or being their coach, and yet here you were. It made more sense that you were blanking out than that a whole soccer team full of boys would pull such an elaborate prank on a complete stranger. They definitely were acting like they knew you, so it’s probably best just to roll with it. Besides, you can’t help but feel a little bit of pride to know that you’re the coach of these fine young boys. They’re actually very good with quick reflexes and nice muscles for ten year olds, and they’re all playing fairly and with good teamwork skills.

The next couple of minutes are quick and action-packed; you watch the two groups of boys perform some talented maneuvers, blocks, and kicks. Eventually, though, one of the “skins” scored a tight kick, sending the ball past the “shirt” goalie and scoring a goal for his team. Although only one group had won, all of them cheered and congratulated the boy, an older kid with brown hair and bright blue eyes who was apparently named Jake. In fact, he seemed to be the best of the boys, and he was a little more toned than the others.

... Wait a minute. Something’s not right. As the boys run around, cheering and moving around the field, they seem to be inching upwards. Their black shorts ride up the growing columns of their legs, covering less and less as the legs expand, pressing against the fabric. After all the cheering is over, the smallest of them is actually a little under five feet tall. Jake, who was the biggest of them, was actually pretty close to your height now, probably only a few inches shy. Their uniforms, or shorts in the case of some of the boys, were stretched tight against bodies that were now a couple of feet bigger. From across the street, an awful splintering and cracking sound came from Brian's house, as the roof started to bulge, and you gasped as the walls collapsed outward, revealing two smooth brown-skinned feet that had to be nearly eight feet long! From the hole that had formed in the roof, you saw a very large head covered in messy black hair force its way through, and a loud, ominous giggling filled the air, one that you recognized all too easily as the voice of Brian’s eleven year old brother Lee.

Within a few more seconds, the titanic boy’s seated body had gotten big enough to completely fill the space where a house had once stood, the roofline of the neighboring houses only coming up to his chest level while sitting. He looked around at his surroundings with the widest grin you had ever seen. As your eyes trabeled back down at ground level, you saw that Lee’s cock seemed to be large even for his size, sprawled across the (formerly) front lawn and oozing a steady stream of pre. As he stood up, the ground shook once more, and a car alarm started going off two houses over. "Now that's more like it!" Lee's voice boomed across the neighborhood.

Things were getting way too weird way too fast, and you weren't sure what you could do to stop them. If Lee was this big already, was there a possibility the triplets could grow that huge as well? And was there anything you could do to stop this growth, or even reverse it?

As you turned back around to check on the triplets, you saw…

15.content:
"What the..." you mumble groggily.

Somehow, you must have sleep-walked downstairs to the kitchen. Blinking, you slowly climb onto your feet. But...something seems off. Squinting the sleep out of your eyes, you make your way over to the fridge.

This can't be your kitchen. You've just realized what was off; the place was huge. The room, the appliances, everything. It looked exactly like your real kitchen, but it was built like it was meant for someone twice your height!

Dream or not, you really didn't want to meet the guy who lived here. Turning away, you bolt for the door. But it's locked! Thinking fast, you try to remember where your mom kept the key for the door. Of course! She'd hang it on a nail over the door frame! You loved teasing your little brother by putting it up there since he still couldn't reach it.

But now it didn't seem so funny; the key was there all right, but now you were far too small to reach it! Desperate for escape, you make a running jump for the key, miss it by a few feet easy...and slam into the wall.

"Huh?" Calls a tired voice behind you. "Whozzat?"

Oh crap! It's the giant! Pulse pounding, you jump back to your feet and turn around to see -

Your little brother, Alex.

"Big bro?" Alex mumbles sleepily. "Where are we? Why is everything so big?"

"Quiet!" You snap, sharply. You wince a bit as Alex looks a little hurt. But hey, it's not your fault! He just scared the crap out of you!

"I think we're in some giant version of our house." You explain, as calmly as you can. "I don't really know, but the key to the back door is up on the nail just like at our house. I'm trying to get to it, but-"

"But you're too short." Alex snickered.

You growled lowly. Sure, you got the irony, but the little shrimp was not about to make fun of you!

"Can it, squirt! Now get over here." You ordered, bracing yourself on the door.

When Alex walked up to you, you quickly crouched down.

"Listen up. We really need that key. So I want you to stand on my shoulders and grab it. Okay?"

Alex hesitantly nodded.

"Good. Hop up."

It took a minute, but after a few bad starts you managed to stand up with your kid brother on your shoulders. You winced as the pressure from his weight moved from your whole shoulder to a tiny point on each side. Great...Alex had to use tippy-toes. Stupid midget.

"Can you get it?" You ask, grimacing in discomfort.

"I...I think s-OW!" Alex suddenly shouted in surprise and pain, falling backward off your shoulders onto the floor.

"What happened?" You demand, rounding on him and picking him up by the arm. "Did you get it?"

"The stupid key shocked me!" Alex exclaimed, rubbing his arm where you grabbed him. "I barely touched it; it's too high up!"

Alex's hair was standing on end. Not hard; he had short spiky hair anyway. But you could actually smell ozone, like lightning had just struck. Wincing, your kid brother rubbed his back where he hit the ground, and wiggled in his clothes, trying to pull them back into place around his body after his fall.

Well, that was his own fault. Everyone knew you only wore baggy clothes to bed, or nothing. Why was Alex wearing such tight clothes for pajamas?

Wait. You blinked, and looked down at your kid brother. Did he look different? You could swear that his head didn't reach your chest before. Nah. It was probably because his hair was sticking straight up or something.

"Well, let's look around." you order. "Maybe we can find some tongs or something, so we don't have to touch the key."

"Do we have to right now?" Alex whined. "I feel weird. All tingly, and sore. Can I rest for a minute?"
15.title: A Different Perspective

151.content:
"No!" You shouted, grabbing Alex by the arm and shoving him towards the door that would lead to the living room. "Get looking!"

"Ouch! Okay, okay!" He shouted back, looking equal parts annoyed and hurt. He rubbed his arm and slowly made his way across the kitchen, shoulders hunched a little. You just rolled your eyes and went in the opposite direction. Your house was nothing super huge or special. It was two stories with the kitchen being the first room you enter as soon as you step through the front door, after moving down a small entrance way, with the laundry room to the immediate left of that and the basement to the immediate right. Passed the kitchen was the dining room which led into the living room on the right. Down the hall adjacent to the living room was your parent's room, the downstairs bathroom, and the staircase leading up to the second floor. The second floor consisted mostly of a hallway that led to your brother's room and your room, which was at the end of the hall, along with the upstairs bathroom and a closet. You weren't sure where you would be able to find anything to use to grab the key, but you decided to stick to the kitchen for now. Maybe you could find a pair of rubber gloves or something.

As you ran to the sink, Alex dragged himself into the living room, looking around at all the massive furniture and appliances. The TV especially held his interest. He had always been jealous of his friend's big screen TV and he had begged his parents to get one but they had always refused, saying it was far too expensive for them. Here, however, the TV was at least twice the size than the one they had at home! He grinned and began hunting around for the remote, totally forgetting about the original plan of finding something to touch the key with. Touching the key would mean one thing: Leaving. And why would he want to leave? This was still his house right? It's not like they were in any immediate danger. Eventually he found the remote sitting on the coffee table. He put his hands on his hips as he looked up at it, sitting there out of his reach, taunting him. He looked around for something, anything to stand on, but couldn't see anything suitable. The closest thing was the couch and it was far too big for him to climb up on. He idly pulled at his collar which had begun to feel overly tight on him...

Meanwhile, you had reached the sink and were pulling open the cupboard door underneath it. Dish soap, sponges, various household cleaners, paper towels...you shifted all of this aside in your search for a pair of rubber gloves. Just when you were about to lose hope, you shoved a particularly hefty box of soap flakes aside and found a pair of blue rubber gloves stacked on top of each other underneath. You grabbed one of them and ran back towards the door, calling out your brother's name.

"Alex! Alex where are you? I got something to help!" You looked around, but he was nowhere in sight. "Now where did he go?"

With a sigh, you set the rubber glove down next to the door and headed into the living room, looking around for your brother. You saw him standing with his arms crossed in front of the coffee table, his head tilted. Getting frustrated, you ran up to him and grabbed him by the arm, turning him around. "Hey! What are you doing?"

"I was just thinking about how I could get the remote..." He said, not looking up into your eyes.

"What?! I thought I told you to look for something to grab the key with! Don't you want to get out of here?"

Alex, a sullen look coming into his eyes, merely shrugged and said, "I don't know. Why should I?"

"Look around! Something is definitely wrong about this place! Don't you get it?"

Alex just shrugged again and tugged his arm free, taking a few steps back from his brother. "It's still our house. And that isn't going anywhere anyway. Why can't we just hang out here for a little bit?"

You sighed in exasperation. Fighting wasn't going to get you anywhere. You took a deep breath and said, "Why don't we get the key first and then we can hang out for a bit?"

Alex looked surprised at this compromise. "Really? You mean it?"

"Yup!" You said, fingers crossed behind your back. "Just help me get the key first okay?"

"Okay!"

With a big smile on his face, Alex eagerly made his way back to the door. You felt a little bit bad about lying to him, but desperate times called for desperate measures! When you both were back at the door, Alex looked around confused. "What are we going to use to reach it?"

"The glove!" You said, crouching down so Alex could get on your shoulders. "It's right by the door."

"Uh...no it's not." He said.

"What are you talking about?" He said, getting back up and looking over towards your brother.

"Look!" He pointed at the door. Sure enough, there was not a rubber glove in sight.

"What the..." Did someone move it? As far as you knew, you two were the only ones in here... "Stay here for a second. I'll go get the other one."

Alex sighed and sat down, looking bored with the proceedings. You sprinted back to the cupboard and threw the door open again...only to see that everything that had once been in there was now gone! Not a single thing remained! What the hell was going on here? You decided to sprint back to Alex and come up with a new plan. When you got back to where Alex was sitting...
151.title: Stranger Things

choices: Alex grows after dinner
