Alex hears your mouse-like voice and gets up. "Hey! Give Justin back!" He charges after the smaller giant.

Hunter didn't expect Alex to hear you and frantically looks for somewhere to hide. "Crap crap." In his rare moment of fear, your gargantuan brother catches him and wraps a hand around his waist picking him up.

"Give me my brother now." Alex demands as he applies pressure to Hunter's much smaller body.

The bratty boy can't help crying out in pain and his hands open dropping you.

"H-hey! Alex!" You scream out as you start your fall towards the ground below.

But your giant brother quickly holds out his palm to catch you and brings you up to his shoulder. "Don't worry Justin you're safe with me." He pats your head as you catch your breath from almost dieing yet again.

Hunter is near crying and pleads with the gargantuan boy. "P-please let me go Alex. You have him back."

"Nah I think I'll keep you. I've got something for you to do for me." Your brother grins devilishly which scares even you.

"W-what?" Hunter asks scared to know the answer.

Alex sets Hunter down but still maintains a firm hold on the boy then pushes Hunter's head against his massive tool and moans as he does so. "I dunno why but its really liking how big I am and" He grins wider "that felt really good just now."

Hunter blushes and tries to get away but his struggles only serve to pleasure Alex.

"Oh OOooh OOOOOH don't stop little boy mmmmmm!" Alex holds onto Hunter as the boy keeps trying to get away while you watch in stunned silence.

After a minutes of trying Hunter stops struggling and Alex smirks, "Ready now huh? Then suck it."

Hunter glares at Alex then nods and leans forward taking the huge cockhead into his mouth causing Alex to moan in higher tones and his legs to shake some.

"Oh yes good boy." He pats Hunter's head as the inexperienced boy does his best to appease the colossus.

Meanwhile you are still on Alex's shoulder watching this unfold and can't resist stroking yourself. "It is pretty hot..."

Alex grips Hunter harder as he nears climax. "MMm what's ah happening? It feels like I'm gonna pee."

Hunter's eyes go wide. (Eeeeew I don't wanna swallow his pee!) He then tries to get out of Alex's grasp again but is too late as Alex groans loudly and his cock fills Hunter's mouth with his hot seed.

Alex lays back on his expansive ass panting as Hunter falls forward into his lap. "Haa hehe what was that?" He's looking at the white goo leaking out of Hunter's mouth. "Weird its not yellow." He laughs and pets Hunter's head during his blissful moments.

So what happens now?
151331112121211.title: He hears you and comes stomping after you in re...

choices: No way! Stick it out here and figure things out for yourself!
Hell yeah it is! Anything is better than this! Push that button! NOW!
151331112121212.content:
Hunter's hand squeezed you rather hard, cutting off your calls mid breath. You watched peevishly as Alex didn't even think of you! He was too busy flexing his biceps, running his hand down the cobblestones of his abs and bouncing his thick pecs. Sure, it was probably amazing to have a body like that and you knew that if it was you in his position you'd probably do the same thing...But that didn't mean you were going to be happy about it or forgive him for it either! It didn't help that you were starting to feel more and more bug like in comparison to these gargantuan youngsters. Alex was enough of a pain when he was half your size and whiny now that he was over fifty times your size and built like a bodybuilder he was sure to be an even bigger pain! Of course, all of that was secondary to your main problem, this Hunter guy.

Hunter...the name rang zero bells. You couldn't remember a single time when Alex ever talked about him or saw him hanging around in his little group of friends. Was he a new kid or something? Did he even actually exist? Or was he just a product of this crazy situation? There was no way of knowing! It was almost as frustrating as trying to figure out how these two were growing or why the houses in your neighborhood not only all looked the same, but were of varying sizes and spread out as far as the eye could see. You groaned and closed your eyes. The more you thought about the less sense it made.

"Yeah, I'd be groaning too!" Hunter suddenly said, squeezing you again. "When I'm done with you and Alex you're going to wish you never met me!"

"I wish that already you snot nosed little punk." You muttered to yourself, too quietly for him to hear. You were pissed off at him, not suicidal!

"Okay...this is a good hiding spot!" Hunter said, hiding behind a house that was big enough for him to crouch behind and still be hidden. "Now I can focus on you!"

His fingers uncurled and you were suddenly sitting on his massive palm. You gulped as you gazed up at his face, a rather evil grin filling your vision. Being in Alex's hand when he was only about ten or so feet tall had been scary. Being in Hunter's hand at his size, with his intentions, made the experience downright terrifying! You were so fixated on his face you didn't even notice as he gripped the gun in between his fingers, holding it up out of your reach. "You used this little thing to make Alex grow didn't you?"

"Huh? Hey! That was mine!" You shouted somewhat childishly. You were too internally petrified by what Hunter could do with such a weapon to care.

Hunter merely chuckled and said, "Yeah? Too bad! It's mine now!"

As he said this, the gun suddenly expanded rapidly, reaching a size that Hunter could comfortably use. His eyes widened in shock as he saw this before his evil smile returned. "Oh yeah! Now that's service!"

He carelessly dropped you to the ground next to another house that fit your shrunken statue perfectly before he pointed the gun at himself and pulled the trigger, his body becoming bathed in the energy from the gun. You had barely managed to keep the trigger pressed for a few seconds and Alex still got huge. Hunter held the trigger for a good minute or so before he was done, a wicked gleam in his eye. "There!" He said triumphantly. "When I'm done growing, no one will be able to stop me!"

He ran off, the ground quaking under his enormous feet, obviously heading back to challenge Alex. You barely had time to process these events before a voice suddenly called out to you. "Hey! You! Come in here! Quickly!"

You looked around but couldn't see anyone in sight. You could, however, tell that it was coming from inside the house. You sighed, closed your eyes and whispered, "Well, what have I got to lose?" before opening the door and stepping inside. It was very surreal. Once again you were in an exact copy of your house. It was tempting to think that this whole thing had merely been a dream and you were now back in reality, everything completely normal again. You half expected Alex to come running downstairs with a big smile on his face to ask you to play a game with him. Unfortunately you knew this wasn't true and the only way Alex was going to be running down in here would be through the roof! You begin to hunt around the house, looking for whoever called out to you.

"In here! The TV screen!"

You follow the sound of the voice into the living room where the television is located. Instead of a blank screen, however, there's a peculiar pattern of colors, swirling and eddying like a kaleidoscope. It almost made you dizzy to look at it and yet you felt a compulsion to keep staring.

"Good. Now that I have your attention I can help you. There's a lot going on here you don't know about. Forces are at work here that you can't understand. I'm sorry that you've been pulled into this but now, if you want things to go back to how they were, you're going to need to be smart and willing to work hard. Can you do that?"

"What are you talking about? What is this place? Who are you? None of this makes any sense!" You shout, ignoring the voice's question. "I need some answers dammit!"

The colors all suddenly turned various shades of red and started to spike as though in agitation. "Please! I don't have time to explain! I just need to know that you're determined to fight! If not, then nothing will change and you will just have to deal with your new reality."

"Hell yeah I'm going to fight! I'll fight whoever I have to, to get out of this crap!" You shouted back, your face only a few inches from the screen.

"Excellent! Then I can help you! This experience of yours will not end in time. You need to accomplish a task in every reality. There is only two things that will stay in common: You, Alex, and Hunter will be a part of it and only those two can grow when subjected to the proper stimuli while you can only shrink when subjected to the same stimuli. It's already too late for you to accomplish the task you were assigned in this reality. You are going to have to reset reality. I can give you the means to do that but it will only work this once in this reality. I'm running out of time. Here!"

Something was pushed out of the screen, smacking you in the face. With a yelp you fell back onto your butt, rubbing your sore nose. On the ground in front of you was a small, thin metal tube with a big red button on top of it.

"Press the button and your reality will reset! I'm afraid your memories and the memories of your brother and Hunter will also be reset...to an extent."

"What does that mean?" You asked, picking the button up.

"There are...certain things you will remember and certain things that you will forget. Exactly what those things are is completely random. You might very well forget everything I tell you. You might forget that Alex was ever smaller than you if he should start out in the next reality already above his base size. You might forget that Hunter is really your younger adopted brother. Anything is possible. Your entire world could be turned upside down."

Yeesh. You didn't like the sound of that at all! Resetting reality might actually make things worse! "What's my other option?"

"...Other option? I'm not sure I understand."

"Isn't it obvious?! What else can I do besides resetting reality?!"

"I've already told you it's too late! Completing the assigned task in this reality would be far too difficult for you the way things are now. Your best bet is to start over and try again."

"Well, what's my task in this reality?"

"I can't say. I'm physically prevented from divulging that information."

"Ugh...fine! I get it! Maybe I will reset reality or whatever and maybe I won't. I haven't decided yet."

"You are running out of time I'm afraid. If you don't press it soon, you may not have the chance to ever press it."

The colors changed again, this time to a panicked pattern of yellow. "I must go! Good luck!"

The screen blinked off, like the power had been cut, leaving you alone in silence. You gripped the button in your hand and weighed your choices. The voice had said that it would be hard to complete the task in this reality (Oh God, even when things were explained to you they didn't make any damn sense!) but not impossible. For all you knew about this place, that might allow you to keep your memories! Hell, it might immediately free you! Who knows?

The other, somewhat safer, option was to reset everything and start over, hoping that no significant memory loss would occur. Was it worth the risk?
151331112121212.title: Questions Wrapped in Questions

choices: Hunter holds the trigger for another minute, rocketing up in size
Hunter holds the trigger, but only for a few seconds
1513311121212121.content:
You thought this decision over long and carefully. Go to a new reality, but you don't know what it's like. What if it's worse than now? Is it even possible it could be worse than now? But then you weighed in the positives of this reality. You have your brother, Alex, on your side, and Alex is bigger than Hunter, at least that's what you think. You set the button down on a counter and wandered around the house, weighing your options. You thought to yourself about how nice it is to finally have some peace and quiet to think on your own for once. It's been craziness since you've popped into this reality. Unfortunately, that silence was broken by a deep, thundering laugh from above.

The same voice that delivered the laugh bellowed the words, "Where's my toy at?"

"Oh no," you thought, knowing it was Hunter. Was he already done with Alex, and you were the only one left. Had Alex left, or possibly hidden? The only way to find out would be to go outside, but you didn't want to meet the wrath of Hunter again. But you knew you couldn't just stay in the house, Hunter would start demolishing houses one-by-one trying to find you, and you would be caught in the debris when he decided to crush this one.

Just then, the voice overhead grew more agitated. "I'm waiting for my toy to come out of the house." he said, practically toying with you now. If you didn't leave the house, he would find his own means in, and it would probably be worse for you. You finally made the decision to open the door, and leave the house. You couldn't believe your eyes. Outside the door was a huge foot, one that could probably crush at least 5 houses at once. As you slowly panned up this massive body you saw your brother, Alex, being held by a gigantic hand. You gulped as the figure looked down at you, grinning. Hunter was now towering over your brother, and had him in a firm steel grip. To make matters worse, he had the gun pointed at Alex, but in the shrink position.

Hunter was satisfied to see you out of the house, and in one step, completely destroyed the house you had been in. "So much for the button," you thought to yourself. You were in this reality for real, and you HAD to accomplish your mission now. There was no way out besides doing that. But, things were looking grim.

"I really wanted you out here so you could see your brother go down to your level!" Hunter said, while laughing evilly. Alex was trying to escape the grasp of the giant, but it was too much to break free from. You thought back to how tall your brother had been when you shot him. He had shot up to at least 400 feet tall, and now Hunter had his hand wrapped around him as if it was nothing. You remembered to Hunter shooting himself with the gun for a good minute, and estimated he had probably grown 10x taller than he was before. That would put him over 1000 feet tall! You were actually so scared you wanted to cry. There was no way out of this. Your only weapon, your brother, was about to join you as a normal sized human being while Hunter could grow as much as he wanted with his gun.

He aimed, and fired. The trigger was held in for at least 30 seconds, and then he placed Alex on the ground next to you. Hunter smirked down at you two. Alex was so much bigger than you, you only were the size of his ankles, yet Alex was only the size of Hunter's knees. Next to Hunter's foot you were like a little ant, not even taller than his toes. Just like that, Alex started shrinking. Overhead, Hunter laughed with delight and victory, knowing he now had no competition. In a matter of seconds, Alex went from being 400 feet tall to 50 feet tall, to 10 feet tall, down to a measly 5 feet tall. You looked up, and gulped when you saw Hunter. He had the gun pointed towards him, and his hand on the trigger. Then....
1513311121212121.title: No way! Stick it out here and figure things out...

choices: School (Hunter is a genius and already in the ninth grade)
McDonalds, where you're hanging out with your friends
1513311121212122.content:
Yes, you decide, it's worth the risk. You're not about to stay in a world where Alex is a giant, much less that jerk Hunter! This gizmo looks like your only possilbe escape and you've gotta take it while you still can. Without heistation you mash your thumb down on the button.

Whoa! All of a sudden your head is spinning! You'd sit down if you could, but your balance is so shaky that you're fighting just to keep from falling over. It's a battle you ultimately lose and you stumble forward, falling into what feels like a bumpy. cloth-covered wall.

"Get off me, spaz!" a disgusted young voice calls out and the next thing you know you've been shoved backward, hard. You wind up flat on your back, staring up at the angry face of your adopted younger brother, Hunter.

"What's the matter, wimp? Can't even walk right now?" Hunter taunts.

Furious you try to jump up, but you're hit with another wave of dizziness. You shut your eyes tight and when you open them everything has settled down. You slowly stand and glare at your younger sibling.

Your life sucked enough already, but Hunter's inclusion in the family made things worse. Even though he's only twelve Hunter is a mere two inches shorter than you, and he's way better built.

Hunter's defined, magnificent chest strains the tight black tantop he's wearing to the breaking point and leaves bare his bronzed, extremely muscular arms. His abs are a perfect, washboard six-pack and his legs are considerably thicker and more powerful than yours. His sculpted phsysique is that of a teenage bodybuilding champion, but the face underneath that wavy brown hair is indisputably that of a twelve year old.

You meet Hunter's confident, green-eyed gaze for a few seconds, then look away. You'd love to pound Hunter for his smart mouth, but the truth is that whenever the two of you fight it's always Hunter who does the pounding. He's even stronger than he looks, and he's been taking karate at the orphanage since he was since he was six. You're just no match for the tall, He-Boy brown belt.

And Hunter made sure you knew that the first day he arrived. When the two of your retired to the room you were sharing you tried to lay down the law and let your new little bro know who was in charge. Unfortunately he thought he should be, and he beat the crap out of you. Ever since Hunter hasn't hesitated to bully you and push you around. It got bad enough that you even swallowed your pride and went to your parents, but they refused to believe that their precious new son and star athlete was doing anything wrong.

Hunter smirks as he successfully stares you down, then walks foward and deliberately bumps you with his iron-hard shoulder, nearly knocking you down again as he walks past you. Having to put up with this crap at home is bad enough, but you can't believe Hunter is treating you like this in public too! You can't let him get away with bullying you at . . .
1513311121212122.title: A new reality with your buffer little brothers

choices: As big as Hunter was
Even bigger than Hunter!
15133111212121221.content:
Not only did Hunter have the brawn, but he also had the brains as well. Despite being only twelve years old, Hunter was a genius with an IQ of 180 (or at least that's what his official score was, Hunter wasn't even trying to get a high score when he took the test.) Although Hunter could have easily skipped straight to college, he chose instead to go to high school so he could throw around his superiority on all of the other smaller, weaker and dumber ordinary people.

Like you.



“Wait for me!” You say, trying to catch up with Hunter. “Stop walking so fast!”

“Are you trying to tell me what to do?” Hunter turned around and took a step towards you, and you involuntarily took a step back. “I’m not walking too fast; your legs are just too short to keep up with me.
If I slowed down, we’d be both late just because you’re too short to keep up. I guess there’s only one solution.” Before you can protest he suddenly grabbed you and lifted you off the ground, his young muscles bulging as he effortlessly held you in the air, then threw you on top his broad shoulder like a sack of old laundry

“What are you doing? Put me down!” You protest.

“What are you gonna do about it?” Hunter started walking. You tried to get off, but Hunter’s grip was too strong. “Stop struggling, you know you’re too weak to fight me. We’ll get to school a lot faster if I carry you.”

Unable to do anything, you just hung helplessly as he carried you all the way to school. Everyone was looking at the two of you, pointing and giggling at the sight of a giant twelve year old carrying his “big” brother around like he weighed nothing.. You felt so embarrassed you thought you could die.

“Oh look, there’s Alex up ahead.” Hunter said.

You felt a cold pit in your stomach. The last person you wanted to see right now was your other “little” brother Alex. You wanted to run, but Hunter’s grip was unyielding.

Finally Hunter stopped moving and set you back on the ground, but hanging on his shoulder in that awkward position so long had made your legs jello, causing you to wobble. Automatically your hand shot out to grab something to help you balance, and what your hand grabbed as very big and hard.

“If you wanted to feel my muscles, all you had to do was ask.” A familiar voice laughed.

Gulping, you looked up to find your “little” brother Alex, who was…
15133111212121221.title: School (Hunter is a genius and already in the n...

choices: Hunter!
Alex!
151331112121212211.content:
The dark, curly-haired Adonis smirks at you and your face reddens in embarassment when you realize you've inadvertantly grabbed hold of Alex's enormous, perfect left pec. You snatch your hand back as thought it had been burned while your tall, ultra-buff younger brothers share a hearty laugh at your expense. The fricking last thing you need is to feel how large and hard Alex's muscles are; you already know.

You can't even remember a time when Alex wasn't stronger and more ripped than you were. Even though you're the older brother, he's always been the dominant one in your relationship because you could never hope to match his superior strength. You've lost count of the number of times you've been forced to submit to the much more powerful preteen. When your parents started talking about adopting another kid you harbored the secret hope that you'd finally get a real little brother, somebody you could push around and give orders to the way Alex does to you.

Your hope began to die the instant you laid eyes on the overgrown monster of muscle that was Hunter. It expired for good when the twelve year-old titan kicked your butt in your own bedroom. You prayed he and Alex would fight, but they soon become best friends. They're much closer than you and Alex ever were and frequently team-bully you, so much that you actually prefer school now! At least there you're mostly safe and only have Hunter to deal with.

So what is Alex doing here?!?

"Want to feel my arm too, bro?" Alex taunts, flexing up his striated, softball-sized bicep right in your face.

"What are you doing here?" you demand. "You're supposed to be in middle school!"

"Watch the attitude, wimp!" Alex warns. "I've got plenty of time to make it to my school before the first bell. I just wanted to remind you what's we're going to do to you if you try to skip karate club again."

Huh? What's he talking about? You don't take karate!

"He won't," Hunter reassures his brother. "I'll make sure of it"

"But I don't take karate!"

"Yes, you do, and you're not getting out of it. Try to quit again and Alex and I are gonna start using you instead of the punching bag in the basement when we practice."

You start to protest again when Hunter leg-sweeps you with his left leg, sending you falling backward onto the pavement. The next thing you know Hunter's brand-new, hundred and fifty dollar left sneaker is pressing against your throat so hard it's cutting off your air supply.

"I got this, Alex," you hear Hunter calmly assure your biological brother. "See you after school, dude."

Choking you frantically seize Hunter's leg, but trying to move it is like trying to shift an iron rod. The pressure actually increases and the tremendously strong twelve year-old genuis warns you, "Stop struggling, or I'll crush your windpipe."

You release him as black spots start to dance in front of your eyes. Thankfully Hunter removes his foot from your throat before you pass out, allowing you to frantically gulp in air.

"Be at the gym after shool, Justin," Hunter commands, "or Alex and I really will stomp you like a bug."

Leaving you lying there Hunter steps over you and heads up the steps, immediately being greeted by half a dozen people.

Starting to cough you roll over onto your front and slowly stand up.

"Hey, Justin, you okay?" a voice asks.

Turning you see it's Tim Williams, one of your friends. Tim is a couple of inches shorter than you, about the height of Hunter and Alex, though of course he's not nearly as broad or well-muscled as either of your little brothers.

"Hunter?" he asks you sympatheically.

"Yeah," you confirm.

"Sorry, man. What was it this time?"

"He and Alex tried to tell me not to miss today's karate lesson. I don't even take karate!"

Tim looks at you strangely. "Yeah, you do. Monday, Wednesday and Friday after school in the gym with Mr. Kursowa, remember?"

What the-? Mr. Kursowa is the trig teacher; since when did he start doing an after-school martial arts class too? And you certainly didn't sign up for it!

"I've never had a martial arts lesson in my life!" you insist.

"Did Hunter hit you in the head this time? You want me to take you to the nurse?'

"No! I mean, yes, I hit my head on the pavement, but no, I don't need to go to the nurse! I need to know why everyone is telling me I take karate!"

Tim stares at you for a moment, then abruptly bursts out laughing.

"I get it now! You're practicing for what you're gonna tell Hunter and Alex when you cut, right? Gonna pretend you got amnesia from that knock on the head you took? Clever, man, but your bros ain't gonna buy it. That Hunter, he's got a mind like a freaking super-computer! Just go to class; it's only an hour."

The bell rings and Tim swears. "Gotta go! Later, man!" he tells you and hurries into the building. You follow slowly, utterly confused.

You soon realize that this "martial arts class" isn't the only thing you've forgotten. You're completely lost in all of your subjects. The last World History class you remember was about the French Revolution; now you're into World War I!

Could Tim be right? Did hitting your head really give you some kind of partial amnesia?

No, that can't be; Alex and Hunter were talking about karate class BEFORE you hit the pavement. So what's the answer then? You think back over the day and with a start realize that you don't even remember getting up this morning! Your first memory is stumbling against Hunter on the sidewalk. The only thing before that is a crazy dream where Hunter and Alex had grown to be giants and a voice from the television set offered to let you switch realities . . .

That's the last thing you remember; then you were on the sidewalk with Hunter, right after you pushed the button in the dream. Or maybe. . . maybe it wasn't a dream at all . . . No, that can't be! Can it?

You spend the rest of the day frantically going over what you remember of the dream in your mind. The voice said things would be different in the new reality and that what you remembered would be completely random. He told you that there was a task you had to accomplish and you couldn't hope to do it in this reality. He warned you that there was a stimuli which would make you shrink, but would make Alex and Hunter grow.

By the time the final bell rings you're more than halfway convinced that the "dream" was nothing of the kind. You'd sound crazy if you tried to tell this to anyone, but to you it makes sense; it explains everything you're going through. And if it's real, there's something you have to do to fix things, but you haven't got a clue what that is!

You seriously consider skipping the karate class to think more about this, but in the end you decide it's better to go rather than risk the wrath of your Herculean, super-stud siblings. In your gym locker you find a white gi and white belt. Changing you enter the gym, only to find you're the last to arrive. Mr. Kursowa is dressed in a white gi with a black belt. There are half a dozen high school students with green, orange and purple belts. Hunter stands slightly apart from them, his brown belt knotted securely around his lean, extremely well-muscled torso. Next to him is Alex, wearing a brown belt of his own!

No, this is wrong! Alex NEVER took karate, only Hunter did! You stare wide-eyed at them, noticing how the gis are pratically skin-tight across their fantastic physiques, with slivers of their broad, deep chests clearly visible in the V-gap of the uniforms.

Before you even have time to process this Mr. Kursowa calls the class to attention. "First today we have our promotions. Alex, Hunter, if you'll please come up here," the teacher asks in a rather timid tone.

Hunter and Alex swagger toward their sensai, muscles rippling under thir gis, and you are suprised again, this time at the flowing grace of their movements. They're like a pair of tigers, supremely self-assured and utterly deadly. As you and the rest of the class watch Mr. Kursowa officially promotes them both to black belts. After their new symbols of rank are in place they turn back to face the class and everyone else starts to cheer! You can't tell whether it's out of fear or admiration, but either way the two obvious alpha males smugly accept the praise as their due.

"Now Hunter and Alex will be the first to spar today. Begin!"

Your brothers bow to each other, and then launch into a display like nothing you've ever seen before. In spite of their great muscle mass they're quick as lightning and even more limber and fexible than you are. They exchange punches and kicks so fast you have trouble following and you soon realize that neither one is bothering to pull his blows. Only their expert blocking and dodging keeps these iron fists and feet from landing.

"They're not pulling their blows!" you whisper to Todd Michaels, the purple belt next to you. Todd seems entranced by the kid karate jock conflict, but manges to tear his gaze away to stare at you in disbelief. "Hunter and Alex said all sparring would be full-contact, remember?"

No, you don't. You also miss the match's conclusion.

"Now Justin will spar with-"
151331112121212211.title: Starting to figure things out

choices: When you go back to the locker room you hear the voice again!
After you get home you find a familiar-looking key on your dresser . . .
1513311121212122111.content:
"Me?" you ask, unable to believe your own bad luck. "But I'm a white belt and he's a black belt! How's this going to help either of us learn?"

Mr. Kursowa glances nervously toward Hunter, who glares back at him, and it suddenly dawns on you that this match-up isn't luck; it's Hunter getting his way again. With his size, strength, intellect, and attitude Hunter seriously intimidates almost everyone he meets. No one wants to risk angering the awesome twelve year-old paragon, so people usually end up doing whatever Hunter wants them to. It's clear now that he, and not Mr. Kursowa, is the one who's in charge of this class.

"Get up here, Justin," he orders, and you reluctantly obey, walking over to the mat to face your young Atlas of an adopted brother.

No wonder he and Alex wanted you here; not only to see their promotions, but also for the enjoyment of being able to beat you up in front of the rest of the class.

Which is certainly what's going to happen; you know that from bitter experience.

"Begin!" Mr. Kursowa intones and Hunter stalks menacingly toward you. You throw a right hook at him, which he deflects with his left forearm, at the same time palm-striking your face with his right hand. To your surprise, though, the painful impact isn't even enough to bloody your nose.

"Point, Hunter!" Mr. Kursowa announces, to the cheers of Alex and the other students.

Hunter steps back, then delivers a devastating, blindingly fast triple-kick to your stomach, chest and face with his right foot. Again, though, this lacks the force you know Hunter is more than capable of exerting. Why?

Then you get it. If Hunter unleashed his full muscular strength against you, as he did against Alex, the match would be over much too quickly. At the least, you'd be too battered to continue, and Hunter doesn't want that. He wants to draw things out, to spend as much time as he can showing off his far greater physical prowess. It's never been enough for Hunter to simply win; no, he has a deep-seated need to crush anyone who dares to challenge him, to humiliate them as much as possible. The only exception you've ever seen to this behavior is when he competes against Alex; otherwise Hunter is absolutely merciless and frighteningly cruel.

If you had to guess you'd say this tendency stems from his years in the orphanage. All that time staying there, unwanted . . . now he seems driven to prove how much better he is than everyone else, how far above ordinary people he towers, both mentally and physically. Behavior like that's gotta be the result of low self-esteem and overcompensation, right? Otherewise why would he have to rub it in so much?

At that instant the martial arts prodigy leaps up in a textbook perfect spin-kick, his bare foot slamming against your jaw. You sprawl gracelessy before him, as Mr. Kursowa monotonously calls out yet another point for Hunter.

With a growl you stand up and suddenly kick out at your oponent's groin, a move Hunter easily blocks with one hand. He ducks your first punch, sideslips a second, and seizes your wrist in a grip of iron. Before you know what's happening Hunter has spun around and flipped you over his broad shoulders. Once again you find yourself flat on your back, staring up at your younger brother's smirking, brutally handsome face.

Grabbing your arm again Hunter almost effortlessly hauls you to your feet before smoothly slipping back into his stance. This time the unstoppable karate kid launches a rock-hard fist into your solar plexus and, after you've doubled over, downs you with an expert axe kick.

Finally and mercifully Mr. Kursowa calls an end to the match. You slink off the mat, nursing your bruises and wondering sourly if there is really that much difference between this reality and the one where Hunter was a giant. You can at least be thankful that he and Alex haven't discovered whatever will make them grow and you shrink here. That must mean you still have a chance, right?

The voice said that you, Alex, and Hunter would be a part of whatever task needed to be accomplished; does that mean you need their help to do what you must? Or is it their job to try to stop you from doing whatever you need to do? Or could it go either way? Alex was on your side in the end in the last reality; in fact it was only after Hunter got gargantuan that the voice started speaking to you. Was that what made completion of your task so hard, the fact that Hunter grew so much bigger than both of you?

Arrgghhh! You have too many questions and no answers! How are you possibly supposed to figure any of this out?!? You just don't have enough information!
1513311121212122111.title: A battering by Hunter and further thought

choices: your brother Alex.
your friend Tim.
15133111212121221111.content:
You head back to the locker room confused, humiliated, but also determined to figure out what is going on and to succeed in whatever test this reality was giving you. As you stripped down and began to shower the sweat off your body, the impact that the fight had on your bones and muscles suddenly starts to feel much more pronounced. Something about the aching and the dull pain seems almost familiar, as if this isn't the first time your body has gone through this sort of abuse at the hands (or, more likely, fists) of one of your brothers. But with the memories of the previous reality and the realization that you're being put through some sort of strange test, you're not sure which of your memories are real and which are illusions.

You finish the shower up and towel off, heading back over to your locker. Opening it up, you slip your jeans and shirt back on, and crumple the gi into a ball, throwing it to the bottom of the locker, hoping that you'll never have to use it again. As you slam the locker door shut, you begin to feel a steady buzzing in your pocket. You stick your hand in and realize it's your cell phone, but when you bring it out, you're disappointed to see that the caller ID is being blocked: "Unknown Name, Unknown Number". You hit the button twice to send it to voicemail, but before you can slip it back in your pocket, it starts buzzing again, the screen the same as before: "Unknown Name, Unknown Number". It would be nearly impossible for someone to call back that fast, you think. Something weird is going on. You think back to when the voice in the previous reality contacted you through the TV. Could this be the same kind of thing?

After a moment's hesitation, you hit the button to answer the call and bring it up to your ear, your hand trembling slightly both from a sense of nervousness as well as weakness from the pummeling Hunter had given you. "H-hello?"

"It's about time you've answered." The familiar voice seems a bit agitated, but at the same time relieved. "I've been trying to talk to you for an hour now."

You glance around to the left and right. The locker room is fairly empty, though you can still hear a couple of showers running behind you. Luckily, there seems to be no sign of either of your brothers. You sit down on the wooden bench between the lockers, trying to keep your voice low. "Well, I'm sorry to inconvenience you, but I've been busy getting beat up by my hulk of a brother, since I apparently do Karate now. My phone was here in the locker room the whole time." You hope that your agitation and frustration is coming through.

"Yes, well," the voice continued, "now that we're finally getting the chance to talk, I have to say that you don't seem to be doing that much better in this reality than in the last one. But at least you still should be able to accomplish your task if you play your cards right."

"What task?" you ask, your voice getting louder as your blood begins to boil over with rage after all that has happened today. "What the hell am I supposed to be doing?"

"I told you before," the voice sighs, "I am physically prevented from divulging--"

"I don't give a fuck what you are prevented from doing or not doing," you yell into the phone, not caring anymore if anyone else hears you. "I just want to get home! Back to the 'real' reality! Where Alex and Hunter are smaller than me and everything is normal again!"

"Be careful!" the voice hisses back at you. "You can't let your brothers hear that! If either of them realize that this is not the 'real' reality, as you put it, then they might become even more powerful than they are now! If that were to happen, who knows how bad things will get for you?!"

Shaking your head, you think about ending the call right then and there, but you know that you still need more information out of this disembodied voice. "Fine. I'll be quiet. But is there anything you can tell me? Anything that will help me at all?"

"Yes, Justin. I can tell you two things. The first is that you are very close to coming across the stimulus that will make you shrink and your brothers grow. Be careful and be aware, because the smaller you get, the harder it will be for you to accomplish your task. And this stimulus will also have an effect on other people you're coming across in your reality, though what effect that is I cannot know for sure."

"So wait," you interrupt, "are you saying that whatever this stimulus is, it'll affect everyone?"

"Maybe. Perhaps it won't be an obvious effect, depending on the person, but this reality is designed in such a way that if you, your brothers, or anyone or anything else changes, then those who are aware of the nature of this reality will be the only ones who are aware of the changes. Right now, that should only be you. Everyone else will perceive the changes as normal, as if things had always been that way. You quickly shut the door behind you just as the beach going Alex lifted two women in his massive arms to much applause. As you turned around, you realized there was still no body, only the voice. “You’ve got to hurry! You can’t be gawking like that!” The voice sounded angry with you this time, but you’d had enough.

“Why?” you shout arms held high! “What’s the point? I blew it already, right? Alex knows what the stimulus is now…and now I’m here.”

“Well…you didn’t necessarily blow it.” The voice insists its tone back to its softer self. A door in the hallway suddenly shone bright gold. “He’s got some power now, but he’s not in full control yet. He’s broken the barrier once now, but to do it again, anytime he wants he needs to find the stimulus in one more dimension, and then he’ll be powerful enough! He’ll be a…How can I put this? He’ll basically own this mansion and all the doors and dimensions within it!”

“So?…He’ll just go to the store and grab a Gatorade.” You say a bit disheartened. “Game over. I lose.”

“No-no-no. The stimulus changes in each dimension. Didn’t you notice?” asks the voice, it’s louder now, drawing you towards the illuminated door.

“Oh! So can you tell me what it is?” you ask eyes upward hoping for an answer.

There was a slight pause, and then…“ I’m sorry; my boss upstairs says I can’t. But I can give you a hint! *Ahem* What isn’t water but flows like a current in the stream?”

“That’s it?” you ask with a frown.

“That’s it.” Say the voice flatly. “-Oh, and it’s remotely linked to the key, and Gatorade before.”

“I’m saving the multiverse and that’s all you can give me?” you frown feeling that even with whatever was helping you Alex might still have the advantage.

”Well one bonus-When Alex punched reality, he sort of picked the universe he’d go to next so you’re going to be at a disadvantage."

You frown even harder "Not exactly a bonus!" you shout.

"I'm getting to it! Fortunately, since you didn't reset things this time, you'll remember everything up to this point, but HE won’t.” explains the voice.

“Okay.” Feeling the playing field was a bit more even. "So, he won't know he's been growing, he'll think everything in that world has been the way it's always been...So when I find the stimulus this ‘master stimulus’ whatever it is. What do I do then?”

“…I can’t say. Just keep Alex from finding out about it. I’ve given you all the help I can. Now go! Save the multiverse Justin!” the voice urges you on from just behind you, and with that the golden door suddenly fly’s open and you’re drawn inside….

Slowly you wake up in this universe where...
15133111212121221111122122.title: Voicing your unhappiness

choices: Only a few- Alex is imposing, but not ludicrously tall.
Hundreds, maybe thousands- Alex is HUGE, practically a demigod here!
151331112121212211111221221.content:
"Time to get up, shrimp!"

At first you think you're about to get teased by your brother yet again as you wake up, but then you open your eyes, and see the reality of the situation is much, much stranger.

Alex isn't here, but his image sure is. Posters of Alex in various poses and levels of dress, all adorned with the same smug smile, cover your walls. Slowly looking down, you see you've been sleeping in a bed with Alex's giant smiling face imposed on the sheets. Your rug also has him on it, focusing on a floor-to-ceiling shot that makes it look like he's standing on the other side of a glass floor, and the computer in your room has Alex in the Thinker pose as the background. That voice you heard? It came from your bobble-head Alex alarm clock.

You're forced to blink twice before you can even start processing how weird this is, then eventually make the connection. Riiiiiiight... Alex had the choice to choose any dimension he wanted to be the next one, so he chose one where he was the focus and ruler of everyone. Wow. That kid has some serious ego. You roll your eyes and get out of bed, then go to your bureau to get dressed. You're grateful that your wardrobe doesn't consist of solely Alex-themed clothing... only mostly Alex-themed clothing. You briefly give the shirt bearing Alex's face in a Che Guevara-style logo a bemused look before just settling on a white shirt with khakis.

As you get dressed, you consider how to proceed. You admit that the clues you've been given this time don't make any sense to you yet- but you have an idea on how to get more of them. The stimulus makes you shrink and Hunter and Alex grow. Given that you've woken up here at your normal height, you can assume that you've never unintentionally been in contact with it. (Unless the stimulus only makes you shrink if you KNOW its the stimulus, you consider.) If you can see Hunter or Alex's height in this reality, it'll also tell you how often they've been in contact with it. Hopefully, that won't turn into the fiasco that happened last time. All that's left is to find them. Wait, didn't she say it affected other people somehow? Could that cause this whole Alex-mania thing this reality had going on?

You check the rooms of Hunter and Alex, but aside from more Alex-focused paraphernalia, there's nothing. You furrow your eyebrows and trot downstairs, checking the kitchen next, but instead, find your mother. She's drinking coffee out of a coffee cup that just says "I Alex" on side while watching the news on a miniature television.

"Hey Mom," you ask. "Do you know where Alex is?"

She gives you a look of great confusion. "Shouldn't it be obvious, dear? He lives in New Alexandria, in the Emperor's Building. Been there for years. You were there when he left with Hunter, he'd just gotten too big and important for only our simple abode."

So no Hunter either, then. Whatever, it's not like you were looking forward to meeting the two of them anyway. You get some cereal ready when an opportunity for some answers actually comes to you: an announcement pops up on the miniature television. Alex is going to make a live address, which is due to be broadcast on every news channel. When the live shot appears, you finally get your answer.

How many times has he come in contact with the stimulus?
151331112121212211111221221.title: An Alex centered universe. Where he is pratical...

choices: Use the gun to grow Alex.
Hunter gets the gun.
15133111212122.content:
You tried to stop it, but it was too late.

Again, Hunter's body started to glow, and you groaned at the fact that he was about to grow once more. The remnants of the house shook, as the boy started to expand larger and larger. You and your brother could only watch in horror as Hunter's growth continued. Laughing maniacally now, the arrogant god merely reveled in his power.

You watched as the ever-expanding wall of flesh before you grew closer and closer. Your brother winced in pain as he was pinned under the enormous boy.

"Help,,,," he muttered, as you quickly broke free of your shock. Not knowing how to help him, the two of you continued to stare as he rose higher and higher....
15133111212122.title: Alex knocks Hunter off of him, and you accident...

choices: One of Alex's friends, the same height as he is now.
A boy ten feet tall, who claims to be your ten-year-old brother
A strange man in a pinstripe suit
152.content:
"Okay, fine," you say. "Wait right here. I'll be back in a few minutes."

Alex lies down on the ground, closing his eyes and quickly starting to doze. Shaking your head in disappointment, you turn around and start to explore the kitchen.

There's no doubt about it. This kitchen is laid out exactly the same as yours, right down to the last details: the homework stuck on the refrigerator, the same dishes and silverware in the same cabinets, the photo of the you and your brother from a couple of years ago over by the telephone. You think for a second after you look at the photo. Was there something weird about it? You look back at it, and are stunned to see it almost hazy, as if you can't make out the details. You rub your eyes, but the image stays the same. Strange, you think.

Shaking your head, you turn your attention back to exploring the cabinets. Unfortunately, the tongs are kept on a shelf above the oven, so you wouldn't be able to reach them without climbing up onto the counter. Maybe that would be a last-ditch effort, you think, but for now you look around some more.

Snapping your fingers, you think of something. There's a grabber tool that you use to help clean up garbage and other debris from the front lawn. It should be in the garage, leaning against the workbench, easy enough to reach. You head out of the kitchen, past the stairs and down to the garage door, which opens with a loud creak.

The garage is dark and empty. It's unusual for both your mom's and your dad's cars to not be parked here, especially at night, but that isn't the first unusual thing you've seen so far. You have an idea to maybe open the garage door, but looking up, it too is out of your reach, even moreso than the key. Scowling in frustration, you climb down the three steps onto the cement floor, then run over to the workbench. Sure enough, the grabber tool is there, though it's as tall as you are now. Wrapping your hands around the midsection, you lift it up. It's heavy, but not too hard to carry it with you.

You slowly move back up the steps, seemingly a little more steep than before, and into the house, making sure you quietly close the garage door behind you. As you make your way back to Alex, you notice him stirring and eventually sitting up. When he does, you nearly drop the grabber tool on the ground.

He is significantly larger than he was before, and his clothes prove it. His pajama shirt, tight but still covering his entire chest before, are now a half-shirt, ripping against his arm muscles and revealing a surprisingly-toned stomach. His shorts (you're sure they were full-length pants before) are now skin-tight, near the breaking point and leaving little to the imagination.

He yawns, then stands up, and your jaw drops. He's taller than you now, by a good three or four inches. He looks down at you, surprised a little, then sees what you have in your hands. "Oh, the grab-thingy. Good idea!"

You stare at him for a second, then shake your head in disbelief. "Alex, what happened to you?"

"What do you mean?"

"Look at you! You're clothes are all tight, and you're taller than me now! You're huge!"

Alex half-grins and cocks his head slightly. "Are you sure you're feeling all right, Justin? I've been taller than you for nearly a year now."

For a moment you're speechless, then you shake your head. "No you haven't! Just a few minutes ago you were like eight inches shorter than me! Remember, you stood on my shoulders to try to reach the--"

You stop as you notice the key, which you're pointing at, is now much further away. It was still on its hook above the door, but that door was now much bigger as well. Looking around, you realize that everything in the house has seemingly gotten bigger.

"Or maybe I've shrunken somehow…" you say to yourself. "But wait! Your clothes! They're much tighter on you than before! You must've grown, somehow!"

Laughing, Alex shakes his head. "Nah, bro, I just haven't changed my PJ's in several years. These give me good luck!"

You try to formulate a response, but before you can answer, you hear the sound of footsteps coming down the stairs. Twirling around, you see...
152.title: Fine...(You go search while Alex rests)

choices: Alex gets the key!
You get the key!  It'll only work for Alex!
You get the key!  It'll work for whoever holds it!
1523.content:
Both you and Alex looked on in confusion as a strange man in a pinstripe suit stepped into your giant kitchen. You weren't sure if he was the real owner of this place, but you doubted it; he wasn't any taller than you, and far too small to live comfortably in this house!

Not even acknowledging the two of you, the strange man calmly looked around as if seeing the place for the first time, until his eyes landed on the key.

"There it is," he muttered, glaring up at it like it had personally offended him. Scowling, he turned toward you.

"Are you done with it yet?" He demanded crossly. "I don't know how you got here, and I don't care; just do whatever it is you have to do and get out."

"Excuse me?" You sputtered. Alex looked equally stunned. "Who the heck are you, and what do you mean 'are we done yet?' Where are we, anyway?"

Silent, the stranger turned and looked you and your brother up and down, shooting the occasional glance at the key. Finally, after a glance at the fridge of all places he turned and lifted his hand imperiously toward Alex and snapped his fingers.

Alex promptly dropped like a sack of potatoes. You promptly slammed the man into the wall by his neck.

"What. Did. You. DO?" You growled threateningly. Even if Alex was a major pain most of the time, and REALLY weird stuff was happening, he was still your brother, and this guy DID something to him and -

"He's asleep." The man said simply, not even looking like he was hurting or choking at all.

"...what?"

"Asleep." The man answered in a calm, even tone. "Actually, he's REALLY asleep. This is a dream."

It was like a punch in the gut. Staggering back from the wall, you looked at the pinstripe man with wide eyes.

"I'm dreaming?" You asked, your voice shaking. Quick as nothing, you gave stamped hard on your own foot.

"OW!"

"Not you," Pinstripe rolled his eyes and gestured grandly toward Alex. "Him. This is his dream. I'll admit, I had to guess, but given how odd he looks right now, and how little it seemed to bother him, I figured he was the one dreaming. I was right, too. I can't tell the dreamer he's dreaming."

"Okay, wait, time out." You sat down on the floor. Hard. "This can't be his dream. I mean, I'm me. I'm real. Right?"

"I don't do philosophical arguments." Pinstripe muttered, dusting himself off and walking toward the fridge. "But sure, you're real. So am I. So's that." He jerked his head toward the key.

"The key?" You asked, glancing up. It seemed to shine oddly in the light.

"That's my key." Pinstripe glared at your brother as he ambled back over and sat down beside you. "I spent most of my life trying to get it; it's what brought me here, it lets me have complete control of this place. At least until you two showed up. Up until an hour ago, I was god here."

Pinstripe passed you the photo from the fridge. On it, you could now clearly see you and Alex, but he was way closer to your height than he should have been.

"He's really dreaming." You breathed, staring down. "Is that real too? I mean, is he that big now, for real?"

"How should I know?" Pinstripe grumbled. "I don't even know how you got here! Maybe the key got bored belonging to me for too long, maybe your brother is some kind of dream invading psychic mutant, who cares! I just want you to leave!"

"If your brother dragged you in here by accident, it has to be him that gets you out." The man huffed. "He can do it with the key. Of course, he can do anything else he wants, consciously or subconsciously while he's holding it, as well." He grinned at you. "Looks like he wanted to be the big man at home, huh? Lucky you didn't shrink or something."

"But I think we did!" You insisted, looking around. "Before, Alex was barely tall enough to touch the key from my shoulders, I bet that's still true now, even with the grabbers."

"Oh hell." Pinstripe groaned. "Part of him knows what's really happening, and doesn't want it to stop yet. Just...humor him, I guess. When he's satisfied, he'll let you go."

With that, the odd man hopped up and started back the way he came.

"Wait!" You cried. "You're just going to leave me here alone?"

"Yep." He nodded. "I want no part in this. Stuck in a highly mutable dream-scape controlled by a prepubescent punk with height issues? Literally sounds like a hellish nightmare world from which there is no waking. I'm out of here. Just don't tell him it's a dream. It might cause...problems."

"What kind?" You called out desperately. No use. The man was gone.

"Justin?" Alex muttered groggily from the floor.

"You okay?" You asked, still a little freaked out.

"Sure!" Your brother chirped happily from the floor, slowly rising to his new height. He looked down at you and grinned.

"Ready to go for that key again...shorty?"

This would take some getting used to.
1523.title: In Your Dreams!

choices: Alex has figured out how to use the key, and makes some big changes
Alex doesn't know he can use the key yet, and wanted to show you something else
15231.content:
"Okay, climb on my shoulders--" Alex began.

"Wait a minute," you protested. "What do you mean, climb on your shoulders? I thought you were climbing on mine!"

Alex started laughing, causing you to start to doubt yourself a little. "Are you kidding, Justin? I'd cause your spine to collapse or something! Don't worry, I'll keep still."

Sighing, you realized that he was right. Not only was he now several inches taller than you, but since he still had the proportions of a twelve-year-old who hadn't hit his growth spurt yet, he had rather wide shoulders and probably outweighed you by a good twenty or thirty pounds. It wasn't something you necessarily wanted to do, but if you two were going to get that key, then he was going to have to be the one to lift you up.

"Okay," you said reluctantly, "let me get on." Alex bended down, letting you climb on his back and work your way up until you had a perch on his shoulders. Slowly and steadily, he stood up to his full height.

"All right, now reach for it!" he called out.

"Got it!"

You stood up as high as you could go, as Alex grabbed your ankles with his hands, steadying your legs. He then handed you the grabber tool, which you reached up as high as it could go. Even on your tiptoes, the clasp of the tool was still a good ten or eleven inches from the bottom of the key. You strained your arm, hoping to be able to grab it, but there wasn't going to be any way possible. Finally, you lost your balance, and fell off of Alex's shoulders, hitting your head on the floor.

"OWWWW! DAMMIT!"

You got up and rubbed your head, where a lump felt like it was starting to form. Alex placed his hand on your shoulder. "I'm sorry, bro," he said, his face sincere. "Here, lemmie try one thing." He backed away a dozen or so steps, then got in a stance. You watched in amazement as Alex took a running start, leaping at just the right spot in the floor, and soared through the air. His vertical jump looked more impressive than an NBA star's, something you knew your brother had no earthly business of doing. Was this something that was part of his dream, you thought?

"GOT IT!" Alex exclaimed as his hands grasped the key and pulled it off the hook. You could hear the sound of a shock again and a hissing noise as he fell back down to the ground with it. "Owww!" he said, but didn't drop the key, instead throwing it from hand to hand until he apparently could tolerate it better.

"What the…" you muttered, then said louder, "since when can you jump like that?"

Alex grinned at you and chuckled. "What, are you jealous? I blast my glutes and quads every day! " He quickly turned his attention to the key, which had evidentially stopped shocking him, and he turned it over in his hands. "I don't think this is the key for the door, Justin," he said. "It's way too big!"

He was right, unfortunately. Trying to jam the key into the door, it didn't even come close to fitting. What the hell was this place? you thought to yourself. Am I really in his dream? You look back up the stairs, hoping to see the man in the pinstripe suit come back down, but no one was there.

"Hey, bro!" Alex shouted. "Watch this!"
15231.title: Fly Through The Air

choices: "Now why would I want to go and do a thing like that, and ruin all my fun?"
"You're right! I can have some REAL fun outside with this thing!"
152311.content:
Your brother stuck out his hand, holding the key almost like a magic wand. "KaZAM!" he said with a huge smile across his face. Instantly, a bolt of what looked like lightning, except bright neon pink, shot out of the key and flew across the kitchen. It struck the refrigerator, the door of which flew open. As Alex held out his other hand, a can of soda shot out from the bottom shelf and zipped over to his hand.

"W-what the hell?" you asked. "How'd you do that?"

"What do you mean?" Alex just grinned even wider as he popped open the soda. "I have THE KEY!"

You recalled Pinstripe's words: "He can do anything else he wants, consciously or subconsciously while he's holding it, as well." Had Alex already figured this out on his own, just in the past few seconds of holding the key? Your knew your brother was smart, but this was just crazy.

"Ya want anything, bro?"

Without letting you answer, he flicked the key again, and a can zipped your way, like a large bullet fired from a gun. Not expecting it, you could only duck as it flew past your head, missing you by mere inches, and hitting the wall with a loud CRUNCH sound. Turning around, you saw that the can had embedded itself into the drywall, the bottom sticking out by a couple of inches.

"Wow," Alex said, shaking his head, "you've gotta be more prepared, Justin!"

"I-- I just--" You swallowed hard, unsure of exactly what to say. "I guess I just wasn't expecting to have a soda can shoot at me like that."

Alex's eyes lit up with a mischievous glimmer. "Well, maybe you should learn to expect the unexpected from now on." That statement scared you immensely, and you hoped Alex wasn't being serious.

He turned his attention to the living room, looking over at the entertainment center. "Hey, Justin," he called as you followed him in there. "You know how we both wanted to get a Playstation 3 for Christmas?" Whipping the key out again, the pink light flew out of its tip and hit the entertainment center. Right before your eyes, you saw the entertainment center morph and change, the television stretching out, becoming much larger, eventually taking up the entire wall from the floor to the ceiling. In front of the screen, various game consoles began to appear from all different companies and eras, over two dozen different ones in all.

"There!" Alex crossed his arms, a grin appearing on his face. "Still... there's something missing... Oh yeah!" Flicking the key again towards the side wall, large stacks of video game boxes started sprouting out of the ground. Row after row, stack after stack appeared, tens of thousands of games in all.

"Alright," your brother now appeared satisfied. "Wanna play, Justin? We have every game ever made now!"

"Uhhh, no..." Playing a video game was the last thing on your mind right now.

Alex shrugged. "Suit yourself." He walked over to the stacks of games and picked one, seemingly at random, walking over to one of the consoles and sticking in the disk. He grabbed a controller and plopped down on the couch, which was still oversized despite his bigger body. He hit a button on the TV remote, causing the huge screen to light up to a bright, flashy intro screen. His feet dangled off the edge of the couch as he started playing.

You shook your head in amazement as you tried to make sense of it all. Telekinesis, being able to transform things like he did... it wasn't right. Pinstripe's explanation was crazy, but it was the only thing that came anywhere close to making sense. If you truly were stuck in one of Alex's dreams, you just hoped that it stayed as relatively safe and straight-forward as it had so far; you remembered having some really crazy, kinky dreams when you were his age.

Looking back up at Alex, though, brought back another worry from earlier. Right before your eyes, Alex was getting bigger, his skinny legs lengthening and his head inching upwards. You noticed he had set the key in his lap, and while there wasn't the purple lightning coming from it like before, it did appear to be glowing slightly.

"Alex..." you walked in front of the couch, trying to catch his eyes, which were glued on the TV.

"Yeah?" he asked, still focused on the game.

You weren't sure of how to exactly ask him about what you were seeing, so you just decided to be blunt. "Why are you making yourself bigger?"

Your brother paused the game, turning his head towards you with a slight sense of puzzlement in his eye. "What are you talking about, bro? I'm not making any changes to myself! I don't even think I can!"

"But-- you're certainly bigger than before!" As Alex neared seven feet tall, his shirt ripped down the sides, leaving him bare-chested, his lean but bulging torso too much for it to contain.

"Aw, crap!" he cried out. "So much for my lucky shirt."

"There!" you pointed at the remains of the shirt, now in tatters on either side of your brother. "You see! Your shirt fit a few minutes ago, and now it's in tatters!"

Alex chuckled. "I'd hardly say it fit, Justin. You know as well as I do that it's been extremely tight for several years now. I guess its time finally came."

You opened your mouth, starting to speak, but the look on Alex's face appeared genuine; he didn't seem to have any clue that he had been the size of a normal twelve year old just an hour or so before. What's more, the top of your head now only came up to the edge of the couch cushions; the house and everything in it seemed to have grown with him, adapting to his new size. Could this be the 'subconscious' changes Pinstripe was referring to?

Whatever the case, you just were glad that Alex didn't seem to be harboring any malice towards you... at least, not yet. Of course, as he got bigger and started reveling in the power of the key, who knew how that could change? As your heart started to beat slightly faster, you realized one thing: somehow, you had to get the kitchen door open and get out of here.

"Hey!" you shouted, your eyes lighting up. "Alex!"

"Yeah?" Your brother stood back up, stretching a bit, the key back in hand. "What's up?"

An idea, a solution, was formulating in your mind. "So you can do most anything with the key, right? Besides change yourself, I guess?"

Alex nodded. "I think so."

"Well, then," you continued, "why don't you point the key at the door and open it? I know you said it doesn't fit the keyhole, but with that... whatever power it is, the purple zap stuff, you should be able to force it open. Right?" A relieved smile started to form across your face, hopeful that you finally figured out how to escape.

The mirthful look in Alex's eyes, though, caused you to second-guess yourself. He thought for a second, before finally saying:
152311.title: Quick Study

choices: Alex calls you upstairs. He's laughing a little
The house seems to shrink a bit. Alex has made you bigger than him. For now...
152312.content:
Startled out of your thoughts, you wonder what Alex wants you to see. Turning around, you notice he's sitting on the floor near the doorway; the key seems to have vanished. To the side of the door, right next to your brother, is the floor mat where everyone drops off their shoes when they come home. Taking up half the space are your dad's work shoes, blown up to the same huge scale as the rest of the house. Closer are your shoes, and your brother's, both tiny in comparison just like the two of you.

Well, you thought, Pinstripe said he had height issues. I guess dad still makes me feel a bit small sometimes, too.

Your brother's focus wasn't on your dad's giant shoes, though. They were on your shoes, which looked slightly bigger than his own in spite of him dream-growing himself so much already. Not as much bigger as they should have been, but enough that subconsciously he must have thought they were supposed to be bigger than his. Alex grabbed one of your shoes and held it up, looking at you with an excited grin.

"Bro," he whispered excitedly. "You'll never guess! My feet are too big for my shoes!"

"Really." You reply, deadpan. Alex had made himself almost a full head taller than you, and made it so that had always been the case, and he was surprised that his shoes, like all of his other clothes at the moment, didn't fit.

Clearly he missed the sarcasm, because he just nodded so fast his head looked like it might come off, grinning hugely.

"Ahuh! I just tried them, 'cause I thought it'd be safer to have my shoes on, but my feet wouldn't go in."

He looked down at the shoe (your shoe) in his hands, and then back up at you, wide eyed.

"I wanted you to see, when I tried yours." He said quietly. Then, poking his tongue out, he started to do just as he said, and slipped the shoe onto his foot. Or at least, he tried.

"Oof." He grunted softly, as the toe of your shoe bulged out with pressure. The heel of his foot was still hanging over the back! Slowly, he peeled it off and set it down, and looked at you grinning wider than ever.

"This is just like dad said!" He almost yelled, grinning.

"What?" You asked, looking at your brother in confusion. This was his dream; so clearly this was something he wanted to be happening, but you could admit at least to yourself when you were completely lost.

"I talk with dad sometimes," Alex said, standing up to pace. He paused briefly to beam down at the top of your head, because even in his dream, he probably realized on some level that this angle was new, and he loved it.

"He knows I hate...hated being little, and how everyone picks on me," his story was a bit confusing with the dream-logic," but he said he was little too for his age and one day he woke up and none of his shoes fit anymore, and he started growing real fast! He got to play basketball in school and got picked first a lot, just like you! And I remember kinda a few years ago when we were almost the same size and then your feet got really big and I couldn't walk around in your shoes and then..."

He slowly panted a bit, beaming, as his story wound down. Suddenly you understood this place a bit better. The giant house, with everything you needed always out of reach. Alex suddenly always being the bigger brother, but the house changing so that he was still too little, and even his sudden basketball jumping skills and now the shoes.

Humor him, Pinstripe had said. Well, it was his dream, and you loved your little brother, so why not?

"Wow Alex!" You exclaimed, maybe hamming it up a bit. You plopped down quickly and stuck out your foot, matching it up so that you could both see how your toes stopped where his toes started.

Alex laughed, wiggling his toes and curling them over the tops of your feet.

"I bet you're right!" You said. "And you're already outgrowing my shoes! I'll bet you'll be first pick on your school teams in no time!"

"Yeah!" Alex cheered, hopping up and racing for the stairs. You see him scowl slightly at their size; the house is still keeping everything out of easy reach. Then he smiles and turns back toward you.

"I'm gonna go change into some daytime clothes," he calls back as he slowly clambers up the steps. "Maybe not socks though!" He giggles.

You smile and nod a bit to yourself as you sit down to wait him out; 'humoring him' might not be too bad.

Suddenly...
152312.title: Big Shoes to Fill

choices: Alex started getting heavier. He was growing now, but you stayed at 10ft
You and Alex go out to the mall and you kept getting bigger
1523122.content:
You stood in the hall while waiting for your brother to finish. You couldn't even reach the TV remote now could you? Could you? Before Alex went upstairs, you couldn't reach the remote on the desk, but now you could. In fact, you could only reach them if you bent down slightly. Alex came down stairs now shorter than you. It was like nothing ever happened. The two of you entered the living room.
"What's like being so tall?" You were surprised by his answer as he could easily grow himself as he did earlier, not that he was aware that he did.

15512.content:
Justin tried to clear his head, but he couldn't shake a constant feeling of being dazed and completely out of it. As the stage hand guided him to his spot, checked him over from head to toe one last time, and then ran off the set, Justin realized that he might have a hard time ahead of him, as he looked up to something that looked like a man-made cliffside that stretched at least forty feet above his head. He started to ask what the hell was going on when a spotlight flicked on overhead, startling him, and the audience started to cheer wildly.

"Ooouuur first event," the host said, dragging out the words in a way that Justin found particularly annoying, "will be the Race to the Top! Justin and Mark, you both find yourselves at the bottom of identically-designed rock walls." Justin glanced to his left to see that Mark was, indeed, also standing beneath a forty-foot high cliffside. "Your goal is to climb up the wall and grab the flag sticking out of the top. But bewaaare! As each of you ascend the wall, there will be certain... obstructions... that come your way, some of which may knock you down, perhaps even all the way to the bottom! Are you rrrrready??!"

"Uhh," Justin stuttered, "not really. Shouldn't we have some sort of safety harness or someth--"

"Get Set! And GO!"

Frustrated, Justin nevertheless whirled around and started climbing up the wall. "This should be a piece of cake," he thought to himself. "After all, how good a climber can that scrawny little--"

He stopped himself as, out of the corner of his eyes, he saw Mark zipping up his side of the wall, as natural and as nimble as a monkey climbing a tree. He already had shot out ahead of Justin, and the audience was cheering him on. "Maa-aark! Maa-aark!"

"Stupid kid," Justin muttered, as he kicked it into high gear. He started pulling himself up higher, putting in an extra effort, and within thirty seconds, the two were dead even at the halfway point.

"Ittt's anybody's race at this point, folks," O'Malley called out. "But let's see if the boys can handle what they're about to encounter!"

As Justin looked down to make sure he had the proper footing, he heard a loud rumbling coming from up above. He looked up and his eyes widened as he saw several large, heavy-looking boulders tumbling down the side of the wall at him. Panicking, he covered his head with one arm while clutching on with his other to the handhold. One of the boulder's hit right where his hand was gripping, the shock knocking him loose, causing the crowd to let out a collective gasp. Justin started falling, but instinctively reached out with one hand to grab something, anything, and stopped his fall, only having lost a few feet.

"Ooooh, that was a close one for Justin," O' Malley egged him on. "Will he be able to catch up to Mark now?"

Justin glanced over and saw that Mark was now three-quarters of the way up the wall. "How the hell did he survive that?" he asked. Shaking off the pain still in his fingers, he tried in vain to catch up, but by the time he was back to where he was before he fell, Mark had already gotten to the top and grabbed the flag. Bells started ringing and lights started to flash, and Mark let out a cheer.

"And we have a winner!" O'Malley yelled out. Dejected, Justin carefully made his way down the wall again, while Mark walked down the stairs that apparently were built into the backside of the wall. When Justin got to the bottom, a stage hand shoved him towards the right, where the host was standing with a beaming Mark.

As the other assistants started moving the rock wall sets away, Justin noticed that, while the boulders on his side had to be pushed away one at a time by several stage hands at once, the assistants clearing Mark's side were lifting them up with practically no effort at all. "Son of a bitch." He muttered. "His must've been made of styrofoam."

"Okay, Mark," O'Malley said, "since you won Round 1, you've won…" He paused for dramatic effect. "Eighteen inches added to your height!"

"All right!" Mark pumped his fists in the air, celebrating, while the crowd's cheers grew even louder.

Justin, meanwhile, wrinkled his nose in confusion. "Eighteen inches? What the--" He stopped as he saw Mark starting to inch higher and higher. At first, Justin thought it was just an optical illusion, but after a few seconds, he saw that the boy's clothes were growing tighter and tighter, revealing more skin than they ought to. For his part, Mark looked like he was immensely enjoying the growth, maybe even a little too much, Justin thought. By the time it was over, the ten-year-old was now the same height as Justin.

"All right, Mark, we'll have to get you some new clothes before the next round starts!" The audience laughed in unison as O'Malley grinned, and Justin shook his head in disgust. Whatever was happening around him needed to stop, and now before it got even crazier. He just had no idea what was going to happen next.

"Urrrghhhh", you moan, as you groggily come to. Looking around, you notice you're in a bedroom of some sorts. At first, you figure it must be yours (after all, who else's bedroom would you fall asleep in?), but when your eyes begin to focus, you see that the walls are painted a dark forest green, and several posters and pictures decorate it - most of the posters featuring shirtless young male movie stars. "You have cyclical amnesia that hits you once every month," Sam explains.

"What do you mean? How is this even possible?" You ask, more than a bit thunderstruck.

"You have what is called 'recurring transient global amnesia.' Once every month you forget where and who you are."

That last part caught you off guard. You still knew your own name, right? And while you might have been wrong about having a girlfriend, where did you get that feeling in the first place? And you definitely still knew certain details about yourself, like your birthday and even your Social Security number. At least, you're pretty sure you did.

"I know what you're thinking, because you always ask this question next. Yes, you do remember certain details about yourself. Other details get slightly warped shall we say. Like this 'girlfriend' you always think that you have. Your brain is vaguely aware that you have a significant other, but can't access the information to tell you that it's me. So you think you have a girlfriend even though you can't remember anything about her, even her name. Basically, you remember some general details, like your birthday, but lose most of the specifics, like that fact that I'm your boyfriend." You can't help but notice that Sam moves a little bit close every time he mentions he's your boyfriend, as if to emphasize that point.

Your memory will come back. It always has before, and it will this time."

"The afterlife." Sam explains, "This city is mostly a recreation of cities that we both knew back when we were alive. Mostly New York, to be honest. But there isn't any single location I can point to--I can create as much space as I want to. It's just one of the many perks this job affords me!"

You're not sure you completely understand, but you're not sure he could explain it any better, so you just asked another question. "And where is everyone else? The other 998 boys?"

"They're in the suburb, probably. Spatially, it's over there," he points off into the distance. Even squinting your eyes, you can't make anything out but grass, at least not from this size. "But of course we would never walk there, even at this size! Not when I can just poof us wherever we want."

"...do your powers have any limits?"

"A few. I can't kill any of you guys, at least not permanently. I can't make you do something you don't want to do...though there are still ways I can be persuasive, of course," he explained with a grin. "Oh, and I can't leave this space. We're stuck here for eternity, I'm afraid."

You're still not entirely sure where exactly "here" is, but you don't want to press it. You have too many other questions to ask. You pause for a second to collect your thoughts, deciding what exactly you want to ask your giant boyfriend/master again.

info.brief_description: You're trapped somewhere with a boy (or boys) who is smaller than you... But not for long!
info.description:
Based on a story that has seemed to have been deleted from this site a while ago... I forget the title and the author (if you can tell what I'm talking about or are the original author, tell me and I will attribute properly).

You are Justin, a seventeen-year-old boy, tall and handsome, and used to getting your way and being in charge. You wake up in some kind of unusual environment, along with a boy or group of boys who is/are younger than you. Over time, they begin to get bigger, eventually towering over you.

I will allow much leeway here, but please follow these rules: the main character can grow if you want but the younger ones should always end up bigger; once a boy has grown he will not get smaller without some sort of major event.

The young boy(s) can be aware or unaware of their growth, and can have other side effects of it too. If you have any questions, please let me know. Thanks!

Check out my portfolio citywalker (47) for my other sci-fi and fantasy stories featuring transformation, muscle development, and growth! And email me if you have any questions or just want to talk.
